analyzed: bag med rnam par spang par gyis //

analyzed: gang gis bag med des rnam rgyal //

translated: he goes to the state of happiness.

original: sgo lnga nas ni dri ma gsum //

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bag med gsungs //
translated: have said that carelessness is the root of cyclic existence.

original: bag med mun pa'i skye gnas yin //

original: bag yod pa ni bde ba yin //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni bde ba yin //
translated: carefulness is the source of happiness.

original: de phyir bde don gnyer skyes bus //
analyzed: de phyir bde don gnyer skyes bus //

original: bag med rnam par spang bar gyis //
analyzed: bag med rnam par spang bar gyis //
translated: must abandon carelessness.

original: de ltar chu'i rlabs la rtsed mo rtse ba zhes bya ba'i byas lha bag med par gyur pa de dag rnams kyi bag med pa kun tu zhi bar bya ba'i don du rjes su ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams bshad do //🔽lha de dag rnams kyang kun tu rmongs par gyur pa'i phyir na ji ltar de kho na nyid de dag rnams brjod par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de ltar chu'i rlabs la rtsed mo rtse ba zhes bya ba'i byas lha bag med par gyur pa de dag rnams kyi bag med pa kun tu zhi bar bya ba'i don du rjes su ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams bshad do // lha de dag rnams kyang kun tu rmongs par gyur pa'i phyir na ji ltar de kho na nyid de dag rnams brjod par gyur pa na /
translated: Thus, for the sake of pacifying the heedlessness of the gods who are heedlessly playing in the water, the verses of instruction are spoken.🔽But because the gods are confused,

original: de ltar kun tu mi rtogs so //🔽slar yang de kho na bzhin du gang dag nam mkha'i dkyil du song ba rnams dang / mtsho chen po rnam par @466a *//
analyzed: de ltar kun tu mi rtogs so // slar yang de kho na bzhin du gang dag nam mkha'i dkyil du song ba rnams dang / mtsho chen po rnam par @466a *//
translated: they do not understand the truth that is being expressed.🔽Again, as before, some of them go into the sky and some look at the lotus petals of the great lake.

original: rgyas pa'i padma'i 'dab ma rnams la lta ba gang yin pa de dag rnams phan tshun kun tu lta ba la ched cher byed pas /
analyzed: rgyas pa'i padma'i 'dab ma rnams la lta ba gang yin pa de dag rnams phan tshun kun tu lta ba la ched cher byed pas /
translated: Looking at each other,

original: rtse 'jo bar byed cing dga' bar yang byed do //
analyzed: rtse 'jo bar byed cing dga' bar yang byed do //
translated: they play and enjoy themselves.

original: mchog tu snyan par gyur pa'i lha rdzas kyi rnga skad yan lag lnga pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mchog tu snyan par gyur pa'i lha rdzas kyi rnga skad yan lag lnga pa rnams kyis so //
translated: With the five divine types of music that are supremely delightful,

original: yul gzhan rnams kyi gzugs dang dris kyang phan tshun du yid 'phrog par gyur pa'i bde ba rnams kyis kyang rnam par ngoms pa med pa'i yul rnams ni /
analyzed: yul gzhan rnams kyi gzugs dang dris kyang phan tshun du yid 'phrog par gyur pa'i bde ba rnams kyis kyang rnam par ngoms pa med pa'i yul rnams ni /
translated: Even though they enjoy the pleasures of mutual attraction with the forms and scents of other objects, they are never satisfied.

original: lan tsha'i chu bzhin du lan gcig ma yin pa dang lan gcig ma yin par yang nags rnams nyid du rnam par ngoms pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan tsha'i chu bzhin du lan gcig ma yin pa dang lan gcig ma yin par yang nags rnams nyid du rnam par ngoms pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Like drinking salty water, they are never satisfied, again and again, in the forests.

original: lha de dag rnams de kho na bzhin du rnam pa du mar dga' bar byed cing bde ba'ang nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha de dag rnams de kho na bzhin du rnam pa du mar dga' bar byed cing bde ba'ang nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: In this way, the gods enjoy many pleasures and experience happiness.

original: de nas dus shin tu ring bar lha de dag gis nam mkha'i dkyil du rtsed sgrog dag byas nas slar yang gang na rnam par rgyas pa'i mtsho de dang / padma chen po'i nags yod pa der legs par 'bab par byed do //
analyzed: de nas dus shin tu ring bar lha de dag gis nam mkha'i dkyil du rtsed sgrog dag byas nas slar yang gang na rnam par rgyas pa'i mtsho de dang / padma chen po'i nags yod pa der legs par 'bab par byed do //
translated: “After a very long time, the gods will have played in the sky and then they will descend to the lake of expansion and the forest of great lotuses.

original: lha gang yang padma chen po de'i 'dab ma rnams la lhan cig rjes su spyod pa dang bcas nas rnga skad yan lag lnga dang ldan pas glu len par byed pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / kun tu g-yog byed pa de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: lha gang yang padma chen po de'i 'dab ma rnams la lhan cig rjes su spyod pa dang bcas nas rnga skad yan lag lnga dang ldan pas glu len par byed pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / kun tu g-yog byed pa de dag rnams ni /
translated: Whatever gods are on the petals of that great lotus, together with their retinues, sing songs with the five types of instruments,🔽and enjoy themselves, and serve one another.

original: phan tshun du g-yog gi bya bas bgrod cing mthun par 'jug pas rgyags pa la don gcig pa 'dod pa drug la @466b rnam par chags pa'i yid kyis du sa ring du glu len par byed pa dang / mchog tu rtsed mo rtse bar yang byed de //
analyzed: phan tshun du g-yog gi bya bas bgrod cing mthun par 'jug pas rgyags pa la don gcig pa 'dod pa drug la @466b rnam par chags pa'i yid kyis du sa ring du glu len par byed pa dang / mchog tu rtsed mo rtse bar yang byed de //
translated: With minds attached to the six sense objects, they sing songs and play games, their minds intoxicated by the mutual service and agreeable activities.

original: de dag rnams rnam pa du ma dang rnam par rtog pa du mas bde ba rnams nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag rnams rnam pa du ma dang rnam par rtog pa du mas bde ba rnams nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: They experience many kinds of pleasures in many ways.

original: de dag gi bde ba de dag rnams kyang sems bskyed pa dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang / kun tu rtog pa tsam gyis rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi bde ba de dag rnams kyang sems bskyed pa dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang / kun tu rtog pa tsam gyis rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Those pleasures arise together with the arising of the mind and are accomplished by mere imagination.

original: dge ba'i las rnams kyis de ltar yang phun sum tshogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba'i las rnams kyis de ltar yang phun sum tshogs par 'gyur /
translated: In this way, virtuous actions bring about the most perfect results.

original: lha de dag de ltar kun tu rtog pa'i chu'i shugs la rnam par rtog pa'i rlabs kyi phreng ba dang ldan pa'i chu klung chen pos kun tu khyer bar gyur pa de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: lha de dag de ltar kun tu rtog pa'i chu'i shugs la rnam par rtog pa'i rlabs kyi phreng ba dang ldan pa'i chu klung chen pos kun tu khyer bar gyur pa de dag rnams ni /
translated: “The gods are carried away by the great river of conceptual thoughts, which has waves of conceptualization and flows with the force of imagination.

original: mchog tu bag med pa'i yid kyis dus ring du 'da' bar byed do //🔽mtsho chen po de'i padma'i 'dab ma rnams la song ba'i lha rnams la ni /
analyzed: mchog tu bag med pa'i yid kyis dus ring du 'da' bar byed do // mtsho chen po de'i padma'i 'dab ma rnams la song ba'i lha rnams la ni /
translated: With their minds completely careless, they spend a long time in this way.

original: lha rdzas kyi bde ba rnam pa du ma rnams dang rnam par 'dres pa du ma rnams nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi bde ba rnam pa du ma rnams dang rnam par 'dres pa du ma rnams nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: The gods who have gone to the lotus petals of that great lake experience many divine pleasures and enjoyments.

original: de dag de ltar rnam par 'phyan pas bag med par spyod pa de dag rnams la rjes su ba rtse ba'i don dang / bag med pa kun tu spang par bya ba'i don du 'ang 'thab bral gyi bdag po mu su lundha des des sprul pa 'di dag rnams byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag de ltar rnam par 'phyan pas bag med par spyod pa de dag rnams la rjes su ba rtse ba'i don dang / bag med pa kun tu spang par bya ba'i don du 'ang 'thab bral gyi bdag po mu su lundha des des sprul pa 'di dag rnams byed pa yin te /
translated: In order to enjoy himself and to help those who are heedlessly enjoying themselves, Musulundha, lord of the gods in the Heaven Free from Strife, creates these emanations.

original: gzugs dang lang tsho'i rgyags pa rnams kun tu zhing /
analyzed: gzugs dang lang tsho'i rgyags pa rnams kun tu zhing /
translated: They are all intoxicated by their beauty and youth.

original: bya ba'i don du'ang yin no //🔽de bzhin du'ang mtsho chen po rnam par rgyas pa de'i drung de na grib ma sngon po zhes bya ba'i ri thams cad nas @467a *//
analyzed: bya ba'i don du'ang yin no // de bzhin du'ang mtsho chen po rnam par rgyas pa de'i drung de na grib ma sngon po zhes bya ba'i ri thams cad nas @467a *//
translated: This is the purpose of the emanations.

original: kyang shin tu rab tu dang pa'i bee d'urya'i rang bzhin la gser dang dngul gyi khams kyi 'byung khungs rnams dang ldan pa thams cad du bkra zhing bkra bar gyur pa'i nags 'bar ba'i phreng ba rnams dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kyang shin tu rab tu dang pa'i bee d'urya'i rang bzhin la gser dang dngul gyi khams kyi 'byung khungs rnams dang ldan pa thams cad du bkra zhing bkra bar gyur pa'i nags 'bar ba'i phreng ba rnams dang ldan pa /
translated: “ ‘In the same way, in front of the great lake Vast Manifesting, there is a mountain called Blue Shadow. It is made of extremely clear beryl and is a source of gold and silver. It is colorful everywhere and has a garland of blazing forests.

original: 'bab chu stong phrag brgya gser shin tu bsil ba dang rin po che'i 'od kyis kun tu snang bar gyur pa'i rtse mo thams cad la'ang ljon shing gi tshal dang ldan pa dang / padma'i rdzing bu rnams kyis nye bar mdzes pa dang / me tog gi 'byung gnas rnam pa du ma sna tshogs pa rnams kyis nye bar mdzes pa /
analyzed: 'bab chu stong phrag brgya gser shin tu bsil ba dang rin po che'i 'od kyis kun tu snang bar gyur pa'i rtse mo thams cad la'ang ljon shing gi tshal dang ldan pa dang / padma'i rdzing bu rnams kyis nye bar mdzes pa dang / me tog gi 'byung gnas rnam pa du ma sna tshogs pa rnams kyis nye bar mdzes pa /
translated: It is also adorned with many different kinds of flower gardens.

original: 'khri shing gi khang pa stong gis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'khri shing gi khang pa stong gis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: The mountain is also adorned with a thousand vine-covered houses.

original: nye 'khor rnam pa de ltar bur rnam par mdzes pa'i ri'i mchog de la 'thab bral ba'i mnga' bdag des bde ba rgya chen po'i sa na gnas pa'i lha rnams dang / lha gzhan rnams la'ang phan par bya ba'i don du rdzu 'phrul byas pa rnams ni /
analyzed: nye 'khor rnam pa de ltar bur rnam par mdzes pa'i ri'i mchog de la 'thab bral ba'i mnga' bdag des bde ba rgya chen po'i sa na gnas pa'i lha rnams dang / lha gzhan rnams la'ang phan par bya ba'i don du rdzu 'phrul byas pa rnams ni /
translated: “In order to benefit the gods who live on the vast and happy lands of that supreme mountain and other gods as well, the ruler of the Heaven Free from Strife performs miracles.

original: lha rdzas kyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo'i sprul pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo'i sprul pa rnams yin te /
translated: These are emanations of inconceivable divine substances.

original: bde ba rgya chen po'i sa la gnas pa'i lha de dag rnams las thabs thams cad nas bcu 'gyur gyis gzugs dang lang tsho dang mdangs dang mgyogs pa dang spro ba dang gar dang glu dang rgod pa dang 'gying bag dang rtsed 'ji la sbro ba la sogs🔽pa rnams kyis ches lhag pa'i lha rdzas kyi yul gyi rnam pa de srid pa rnams sbrul pa gang yin @467b pa 'di dag gi khyad par gyis lha gzhan de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: bde ba rgya chen po'i sa la gnas pa'i lha de dag rnams las thabs thams cad nas bcu 'gyur gyis gzugs dang lang tsho dang mdangs dang mgyogs pa dang spro ba dang gar dang glu dang rgod pa dang 'gying bag dang rtsed 'ji la sbro ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ches lhag pa'i lha rdzas kyi yul gyi rnam pa de srid pa rnams sbrul pa gang yin @467b pa 'di dag gi khyad par gyis lha gzhan de dag rnams ni /
translated: Compared to the gods who abide on the vast ground of bliss, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three are ten times inferior in terms of their bodies, youthfulness, radiance, speed, enthusiasm, dance, song, playfulness, charm, and enjoyment.

original: bcur byas pa'i cha tsam du'ang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bcur byas pa'i cha tsam du'ang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three are not even a tenth as beautiful as the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife.

original: rim pa thams cad kyis gzugs dang lang tsho dang chad dang mdog dang dbyibs dang rgod pa dang 'gying bag dang glu dang gar dang rtsed mo'i yang rim pa rnams kyi rim pa rnams thams cad kyis kyang cung zad mdzes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rim pa thams cad kyis gzugs dang lang tsho dang chad dang mdog dang dbyibs dang rgod pa dang 'gying bag dang glu dang gar dang rtsed mo'i yang rim pa rnams kyi rim pa rnams thams cad kyis kyang cung zad mdzes pa ma yin no //
translated: In terms of all aspects of their bodies, youthfulness, radiance, color, shape, playfulness, charm, song, dance, and enjoyment, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three are not even slightly attractive.

original: rnam pa de srid du sprul pa de dag rnams phal cher ni /🔽grib ma sngon po'i ri de la ste /🔽nye 'khor kun nas bee d'urya'i rang bzhin yin pa rnams ni /🔽snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de srid du sprul pa de dag rnams phal cher ni / grib ma sngon po'i ri de la ste / nye 'khor kun nas bee d'urya'i rang bzhin yin pa rnams ni / snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As long as these emanations are, for the most part, on that blue mountain of shadows.🔽🔽All around, they are of the nature of beryl,🔽as before.🔽

original: de nas ri'i mchog gang yin pa de'i rtse mo dang / thams cad mchog tu gyur pa de dag rnams las sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams dang / lha mo dag kyang glu len par gyur pas yan lag lnga dang ldan par gyur pa'i rol mo rnams kyang mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: de nas ri'i mchog gang yin pa de'i rtse mo dang / thams cad mchog tu gyur pa de dag rnams las sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams dang / lha mo dag kyang glu len par gyur pas yan lag lnga dang ldan par gyur pa'i rol mo rnams kyang mnyam pa dang /
translated: In this way, the emanations of the gods and goddesses sing songs with the five types of instruments.🔽The songs are captivating, delightful, and beautiful.

original: chags par byed pa dang / snyan par gyur pa rnams byed cing gang na rang bzhin gyi lha de dag rnams gar byed pa dang / 'gying bar byed pas skyed mos tshal gyi ltad mo byed pa der lha mo de dag rnams dang lha de dag rnams rim gyis 'jug go /
analyzed: chags par byed pa dang / snyan par gyur pa rnams byed cing gang na rang bzhin gyi lha de dag rnams gar byed pa dang / 'gying bar byed pas skyed mos tshal gyi ltad mo byed pa der lha mo de dag rnams dang lha de dag rnams rim gyis 'jug go /
translated: The emanated gods and goddesses enter the forest to watch the natural gods dance and strut.

original: de nas lha de dag rnams kyis sprul ba de dag gis glu'i sgra rnams thos par gyur pa dang bcu 'gyur gyis shin tu snyan par gyur pa ni /🔽snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de nas lha de dag rnams kyis sprul ba de dag gis glu'i sgra rnams thos par gyur pa dang bcu 'gyur gyis shin tu snyan par gyur pa ni / snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Then, when the gods hear the songs of the emanated gods, they are ten times more beautiful than before.

original: rang bzhin gyi lha de dag rnams rtse dga' ba la mchog tu'ang zhugs pa dang / lha mo de dag rnams kyis kyang de kho na bzhin du @468a *//🔽rtses par gyur to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi lha de dag rnams rtse dga' ba la mchog tu'ang zhugs pa dang / lha mo de dag rnams kyis kyang de kho na bzhin du @468a *// rtses par gyur to //
translated: The gods of the original realm are also extremely engaged in the delights of play, and the goddesses also play in the same way.

original: de nas sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis dal bus dal bus legs par babs te /🔽de nas phan tshun du gang gi tshe khyad par zhugs bar mthong bar gyur pa de'i tshe rang bzhin gyi lha de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis dal bus dal bus legs par babs te / de nas phan tshun du gang gi tshe khyad par zhugs bar mthong bar gyur pa de'i tshe rang bzhin gyi lha de dag rnams ni /
translated: Then, the emanated gods slowly descend.

original: sprul pa de dag rnams kyi khyad par gyis tshul thams cad kyis mi mdzes so //
analyzed: sprul pa de dag rnams kyi khyad par gyis tshul thams cad kyis mi mdzes so //
translated: When the gods of the original realm see the differences, they are in every way ugly in comparison to the emanations.

original: gzugs lhag pas ni /
analyzed: gzugs lhag pas ni /
translated: Their superior bodies

original: gzugs kyi rgyags pa nye bar bcom mo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyags pa nye bar bcom mo //
translated: destroy the conceit of their bodies.

original: de dag rnams kyis byas pa'i cha byad du byas pa rnams bcom mo //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis byas pa'i cha byad du byas pa rnams bcom mo //
translated: Their superior ornaments destroy the ornaments of the original gods.

original: 'od rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: 'od rnams kyis ni /
translated: The lights

original: rang gi lus las kun tu 'byung ba'i 'od rnams bcom mo //
analyzed: rang gi lus las kun tu 'byung ba'i 'od rnams bcom mo //
translated: overcome the lights that arise from their own bodies.

original: sprul pa'i glu'i dbyangs rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i glu'i dbyangs rnams kyis ni /
translated: The songs of the emanations

original: ngo bo nyid kyi glu'i gdangs rnams nye bar bcom mo //🔽dri rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi glu'i gdangs rnams nye bar bcom mo // dri rnams kyis ni /
translated: overcome the natural songs of the gods.🔽The scents

original: dri rnams bcom mo //
analyzed: dri rnams bcom mo //
translated: overcome the scents.

original: sprul pa'i tshad dang kha dog dang dbyibs rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i tshad dang kha dog dang dbyibs rnams kyis ni /
translated: The sizes, colors, and shapes of the emanations

original: lha de dag rnams lha mo dang lhan cig tu bcas pa rnams kyi tshad dang kha dog dang dbyibs rnams nye bar bcom mo //
analyzed: lha de dag rnams lha mo dang lhan cig tu bcas pa rnams kyi tshad dang kha dog dang dbyibs rnams nye bar bcom mo //
translated: overcome the sizes, colors, and shapes of the gods together with the goddesses.

original: de bzhin du yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i yul gyi bde ba rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i yul gyi bde ba rnams kyis ni /
translated: In the same way, the pleasures of the five senses

original: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i yul gyi bde ba rnams nye bar bcom mo //
analyzed: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i yul gyi bde ba rnams nye bar bcom mo //
translated: overcome the pleasures of the five senses.

original: ji lta ji ltar ngo bo nyid kyi lha rnams kyi rgyags pa chen po thams cad chung ngur byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar ngo bo nyid kyi lha rnams kyi rgyags pa chen po thams cad chung ngur byas par 'gyur te /
translated: As the natural gods’ great intoxication is reduced,

original: thabs rnams thams cad kyis gang gi tshe lha de dag dang / ngo bo nyid kyi lha de dag rnams rnam par 'dre bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: thabs rnams thams cad kyis gang gi tshe lha de dag dang / ngo bo nyid kyi lha de dag rnams rnam par 'dre bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe na'o //
translated: By all means, when those gods and the gods by nature mix together,

original: de ltar de dag rnams @468b kyi sa ngo bo nyid kyi lha rnams kyi gzi brjid de dag de bzhin du zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: de ltar de dag rnams @468b kyi sa ngo bo nyid kyi lha rnams kyi gzi brjid de dag de bzhin du zil gyis gnon te /
translated: then at that time, the gods by nature outshine the splendor of those gods.

original: ji ltar dzambu'i gling du nyi ma shar bar gyur pa na gza' dang skar ma dang rgyu skar rnams kyi gzi brjid nyams par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar dzambu'i gling du nyi ma shar bar gyur pa na gza' dang skar ma dang rgyu skar rnams kyi gzi brjid nyams par byed do //
translated: Just as when the sun rises in Jambudvīpa, it outshines the splendor of the planets, stars, and constellations.

original: de bzhin du sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis lha rnams thams cad kyis 'od zer zil gyis gnon no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis lha rnams thams cad kyis 'od zer zil gyis gnon no //
translated: In the same way, those emanated gods outshine the light of all the gods.

original: ji ltar lha rdzas kyi rol mo rnams kyis mi rnams zil gyis gnon par byed pa de bzhin du rol mo rnams kyang mngon par zil gyis gnon no //
analyzed: ji ltar lha rdzas kyi rol mo rnams kyis mi rnams zil gyis gnon par byed pa de bzhin du rol mo rnams kyang mngon par zil gyis gnon no //
translated: Just as human music is outshone by divine music, in the same way, the music is outshone.

original: glu rnams kyang de bzhin du zil gyis gnon no //
analyzed: glu rnams kyang de bzhin du zil gyis gnon no //
translated: The songs are also outshone in the same way.

original: tshad dang mdog dang dbyibs rnams kyang de bzhin du zil gyis gnon te //
analyzed: tshad dang mdog dang dbyibs rnams kyang de bzhin du zil gyis gnon te //
translated: The emanated gods also surpass them in terms of size, color, and shape.

original: ji ltar 'thab bral bas mi rnams zil gyis gnon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'thab bral bas mi rnams zil gyis gnon pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife surpass humans.

original: de nas ngo bo nyid kyi lha de dag rnams ngo tsha ba dang bcas pas gang na de mtsho chen po de yod pa'i 'gram der nye bar 'gro bar byed do /
analyzed: de nas ngo bo nyid kyi lha de dag rnams ngo tsha ba dang bcas pas gang na de mtsho chen po de yod pa'i 'gram der nye bar 'gro bar byed do /
translated: “ ‘Then, with feelings of embarrassment, the gods will approach the shore of that great lake.

original: ngo tsha ba dang ngo mtshar bar gyur pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis so //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang ngo mtshar bar gyur pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis so //
translated: With feelings of embarrassment and wonder,

original: de nas sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams mtsho de'i gang na padma chen po yod pa yin pa de dang nye bar mngon par gnas nas glu len par byed par gyur /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams mtsho de'i gang na padma chen po yod pa yin pa de dang nye bar mngon par gnas nas glu len par byed par gyur /
translated: “ ‘The emanated gods will then stand near the great lotus in the lake and sing songs.

original: gar byed par gyur /
analyzed: gar byed par gyur /
translated: They will dance.

original: rgod par gyur pas kyang lha rdzas kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i bde ba rnams dang yang dag par ldan pas mtsho de'i steng gi padma chen po'i 'dab ma rnams kyi bar du sang nas gar byed pa dang / rgod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: rgod par gyur pas kyang lha rdzas kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i bde ba rnams dang yang dag par ldan pas mtsho de'i steng gi padma chen po'i 'dab ma rnams kyi bar du sang nas gar byed pa dang / rgod par byed pa dang /
translated: Also, those who are excited experience the perfect bliss of the five divine sense objects and, singing, dancing, and frolicking among the petals of the great lotuses on the lake,

original: 'gying bar byed pa dang / phun tshun grogs @469a *//
analyzed: 'gying bar byed pa dang / phun tshun grogs @469a *//
translated: they are intoxicated and excited.

original: byed pas kyang rgyags pa la don gcig pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: byed pas kyang rgyags pa la don gcig pa rnams yin te /
translated: They are of the same nature as those who are excited.

original: 'thab bral ba rnams las ches lhag pa'i lus can de dag rnams kyis rang bzhin gyi lha rnams la phan par bya ba'i don du de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa mngon par bsnyad pa glu dang legs par 'dres pa rnams bshad pa ji ltar /
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams las ches lhag pa'i lus can de dag rnams kyis rang bzhin gyi lha rnams la phan par bya ba'i don du de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa mngon par bsnyad pa glu dang legs par 'dres pa rnams bshad pa ji ltar /
translated: For the benefit of the gods, those beings who are superior to the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife sing these verses, which are mixed with song, at that time:

original: lha yi bde ba thams cad ni //
analyzed: lha yi bde ba thams cad ni //
translated: “All the happiness of the gods

original: las dang cha 'dra mthong ba yin //
analyzed: las dang cha 'dra mthong ba yin //
translated: is seen to be similar to their karma.

original: gson pa dang ni bde ba yang //
analyzed: gson pa dang ni bde ba yang //
translated: Life and happiness

original: las zad pas ni 'jig pa yin //
analyzed: las zad pas ni 'jig pa yin //
translated: are destroyed by the exhaustion of karma.

original: de phyir rnam pa du ma'i bde //
analyzed: de phyir rnam pa du ma'i bde //
translated: Therefore, there are many kinds of happiness.

original: ji srid zad par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: ji srid zad par ma gyur pa //
translated: As long as they are not exhausted,

original: de srid du ni bsod nams kyis //
analyzed: de srid du ni bsod nams kyis //
translated: for that long, through merit,🔽there is happiness.

original: bsod nams ma byas las sdug bsngal //
analyzed: bsod nams ma byas las sdug bsngal //
translated: If you do not create merit, you will suffer.

original: gson tshe myur ba nyid du 'gro //
analyzed: gson tshe myur ba nyid du 'gro //
translated: Life passes quickly.

original: lang tsho myur bar 'gro ba yin //
analyzed: lang tsho myur bar 'gro ba yin //
translated: Youth passes quickly.

original: 'chi bdag myur ba nyid 'ong gis //
analyzed: 'chi bdag myur ba nyid 'ong gis //
translated: The Lord of Death comes quickly.

original: bag med pa la dga' ma byed //
analyzed: bag med pa la dga' ma byed //
translated: Do not delight in carelessness.

original: lus can kun gyi bde ba kun //
analyzed: lus can kun gyi bde ba kun //
translated: All the happiness of embodied beings

original: 'jig pa'i rgud par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgud par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: will be destroyed by misfortune.

original: gson pa yang ni mthar 'joms na //
analyzed: gson pa yang ni mthar 'joms na //
translated: If life is destroyed in the end,

original: bag med la ni dga' ma byed //🔽dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul la //
analyzed: bag med la ni dga' ma byed // dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul la //
translated: do not delight in carelessness.🔽It is not possible to prevent

original: mi skye bar ni bya mi nus //
analyzed: mi skye bar ni bya mi nus //
translated: the arising of objects for the senses.🔽But the mind can turn away

original: dbang rnams rang gi spyod yul las //🔽gang phyir shes pas zlog par byed //
analyzed: dbang rnams rang gi spyod yul las // gang phyir shes pas zlog par byed //
translated: from the objects of the senses.

original: de phyir rtag tu shes pa bsten //
analyzed: de phyir rtag tu shes pa bsten //
translated: Therefore, always rely on the mind.🔽If you abandon the mind,

original: shes pa yongs su spong ba dang // skyon rnams rtag tu spong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa yongs su spong ba dang // skyon rnams rtag tu spong mi 'gyur //
translated: you will not abandon faults.

original: de ni don min myu gu yin //
analyzed: de ni don min myu gu yin //
translated: That is the seed of non-purpose.

original: bag med pa las 'dod chags skye //
analyzed: bag med pa las 'dod chags skye //
translated: Desire arises from carelessness.

original: 'dod chags las ni sdug bsngal 'byung //
analyzed: 'dod chags las ni sdug bsngal 'byung //
translated: Suffering arises from desire.

original: sdug @469b bsngal gyis bsgrubs skye ba 'di //
analyzed: sdug @469b bsngal gyis bsgrubs skye ba 'di //
translated: Suffering is the result of this birth.

original: de dag 'khor ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de dag 'khor ba'i lam yin no //
translated: This is the path of cyclic existence.

original: bag med yongs su spangs pa gang //
analyzed: bag med yongs su spangs pa gang //
translated: Those who have abandoned carelessness

original: yul 'di ston par mi byed pa //
analyzed: yul 'di ston par mi byed pa //
translated: do not show these objects.

original: de la skyon ni mi dmigs la //
analyzed: de la skyon ni mi dmigs la //
translated: They do not see any faults in them.

original: skyon gyi dngos po grol ba yin //
analyzed: skyon gyi dngos po grol ba yin //
translated: They are free from the things that are faults.

original: sdug bsngal ljon shing rtsa bar ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ljon shing rtsa bar ni //
translated: The root of the tree of suffering

original: bag med 'di gcig rnams par gnas //
analyzed: bag med 'di gcig rnams par gnas //
translated: is this one thing, carelessness.

original: bag med pa la mchog gyur pas //
analyzed: bag med pa la mchog gyur pas //
translated: Because of carelessness, the best

original: skye 'di lam ni thams cad 'joms //
analyzed: skye 'di lam ni thams cad 'joms //
translated: destroy this path of birth.

original: gzugs ni rtag pa mthong ba med //
analyzed: gzugs ni rtag pa mthong ba med //
translated: Form is not seen to be permanent.

original: mnyam du 'gro ba'i bde ba med //
analyzed: mnyam du 'gro ba'i bde ba med //
translated: There is no happiness that goes along with it.

original: srid nas srid par dngos po 'di'i //
analyzed: srid nas srid par dngos po 'di'i //
translated: From existence to existence, this thing

original: kun thob pa yang rnam 'jig 'gyur //
analyzed: kun thob pa yang rnam 'jig 'gyur //
translated: is obtained and then destroyed.

original: yul ni 'ching ba rnams kyi rgyu //
analyzed: yul ni 'ching ba rnams kyi rgyu //
translated: Objects are the cause of all bonds.

original: ji lta ji ltar bstan byas pa //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar bstan byas pa //
translated: Whatever is taught

original: de lta de ltar rnam 'phel te //
analyzed: de lta de ltar rnam 'phel te //
translated: increases in just that way,

original: bud shing las ni me ji bzhin //
analyzed: bud shing las ni me ji bzhin //
translated: just as fire does from fuel.

original: ngoms pa med pa'i sdug bsngal 'di //
analyzed: ngoms pa med pa'i sdug bsngal 'di //
translated: This insatiable suffering

original: 'di ni bde bar 'dir mi brjod //
analyzed: 'di ni bde bar 'dir mi brjod //
translated: This is not called happiness here.

original: 'khor ba las ni kha log pa'i //
analyzed: 'khor ba las ni kha log pa'i //
translated: Those who turn away from cyclic existence

original: gang zhig sred bral de bde yin //
analyzed: gang zhig sred bral de bde yin //
translated: are free from craving and are happy.

original: de phyir gang zhig mthar thug bde //
analyzed: de phyir gang zhig mthar thug bde //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate happiness

original: bde bde de ni bde bar brjod //
analyzed: bde bde de ni bde bar brjod //
translated: is called happiness.

original: 'dod pa 'byung min bde ba ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'byung min bde ba ni //
translated: The happiness that does not arise from desire

original: mthar thug pa yi bde pa yin //
analyzed: mthar thug pa yi bde pa yin //
translated: is the ultimate happiness.

original: de ltar bag med pa rnams kyis shin tu bcom par ma gyur pa'i mu su lundha sa sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis lha de dag rnams la glu la bsnyad nas mchog tu snyan pa snga na ma thos pa'i glu rnams len par byed la //
analyzed: de ltar bag med pa rnams kyis shin tu bcom par ma gyur pa'i mu su lundha sa sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis lha de dag rnams la glu la bsnyad nas mchog tu snyan pa snga na ma thos pa'i glu rnams len par byed la //
translated: In this way, Musulundha, who has not been completely defeated by carelessness, sings to the emanated gods about the emanated gods, and he sings the most beautiful songs that have never been heard before.

original: ji ltar bstan pa dang kun tu bsras pa'i sprul pa'i de kho na nyid rnams ngo bo nyid kyi lha dag gis thos nas nyan par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa dang kun tu bsras pa'i sprul pa'i de kho na nyid rnams ngo bo nyid kyi lha dag gis thos nas nyan par byed do //
translated: The real gods, who have been instructed and are well trained, listen to the songs of the emanated gods.

original: de nas lha de dag gis tshigs @470a *//
analyzed: de nas lha de dag gis tshigs @470a *//
translated: Then the gods sing these verses:

original: dbyangs kyis bsnyed pa thos nas srid pa snga ma la goms par byas par gyur pa yongs su dag pa'i rgyud gang yin pa ji ltar lha de dag gis ches gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyis glu dbyangs kyi don kun tu rtogs nas skyo ba skye bar 'gyur🔽ro // de nas yang bdag cag rnams kyi drung na rim pa rnams thams cad kyis khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa de dag gang gis tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs 'di dag rnams legs par bshad pa yin yang de dag rnams gang yin pa'i drung na bdag cag rnams
analyzed: dbyangs kyis bsnyed pa thos nas srid pa snga ma la goms par byas par gyur pa yongs su dag pa'i rgyud gang yin pa ji ltar lha de dag gis ches gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyis glu dbyangs kyi don kun tu rtogs nas skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro // de nas yang bdag cag rnams kyi drung na rim pa rnams thams cad kyis khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa de dag gang gis tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs 'di dag rnams legs par bshad pa yin yang de dag rnams gang yin pa'i drung na bdag cag rnams
translated: When they hear the songs of the gods, they will understand the meaning of the songs and feel sad, for they are purified continuums that have been accustomed to the past.🔽“ ‘The gods who are the most prominent among them will understand the meaning of the songs and feel sad. Then they will wonder, “Who is it that has so excellently taught these verses that are superior to us in every respect?”

original: ci'i phyir thams cad du shin tu dman par gyur ces de ltar thabs de dag rnams kyis 'thab bral gyi bdag pos snying la legs par go bar byas te bag med pa rnams dang bral bar yang byed do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad du shin tu dman par gyur ces de ltar thabs de dag rnams kyis 'thab bral gyi bdag pos snying la legs par go bar byas te bag med pa rnams dang bral bar yang byed do //
translated: “ ‘In this way, the ruler of the gods will understand the meaning of these verses and will thus free himself from carelessness.

original: thabs gzhan rnams kyis kyang phan par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: thabs gzhan rnams kyis kyang phan par byed pa yin la /
translated: Other means also benefit them.

original: de ltar lha de dag rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i bde ba'i rgyags pa dag gis rgyags par gyur nas log par ltung bar 'gyur ba rab tu ma mthong ba de /
analyzed: de ltar lha de dag rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i bde ba'i rgyags pa dag gis rgyags par gyur nas log par ltung bar 'gyur ba rab tu ma mthong ba de /
translated: Thus, the gods, intoxicated by the intoxication of the pleasures of form and so on, do not see their downfall.

original: phyis 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na 'gyod pa'i mes bsregs nas phyi nas yang dmyal ba'i mes sreg par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na 'gyod pa'i mes bsregs nas phyi nas yang dmyal ba'i mes sreg par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Later, when they die and transmigrate, they are burned by the fire of regret and then burned again by the fire of hell.

original: de la thabs 'di dag gis rang bzhin pa'i lha de dag rnams la phan par 'dod pas mu su lu ndha des kun skyo ba skyed do //
analyzed: de la thabs 'di dag gis rang bzhin pa'i lha de dag rnams la phan par 'dod pas mu su lu ndha des kun skyo ba skyed do //
translated: Musulundha wishes to benefit the gods in this way and so he causes them to feel regret.

original: de nas lha de dag rnams yid byung bar gyur pa rtogs nas yang sprul pa @470b gzhan yang shin tu yid 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i sprul pa rnams byed de /
analyzed: de nas lha de dag rnams yid byung bar gyur pa rtogs nas yang sprul pa @470b gzhan yang shin tu yid 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i sprul pa rnams byed de /
translated: Then, realizing that the gods are feeling regret, he creates other emanations that cause them to feel even more regret.

original: ji ltar padma'i 'dab ma rnams nyid la rnam grangs du ma rnams kyis dga' bar byed pa dang / yongs su glu len par byed pa dang / rnam grangs du mar 'gying bar yang byed pa de ltar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar padma'i 'dab ma rnams nyid la rnam grangs du ma rnams kyis dga' bar byed pa dang / yongs su glu len par byed pa dang / rnam grangs du mar 'gying bar yang byed pa de ltar byed do //
translated: Just as the gods enjoy themselves in many ways on the lotus petals, singing and dancing in many ways,🔽in this way the gods enjoy themselves in many ways, with many different kinds of play, which they have never seen before, in many different ways, with many different kinds of thoughts, and with many different kinds of pleasures.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin gyi lha de dag rnams kyis nam yang 'ga' zhig tu'ang mthong ma myong ba'i rtsed mo de dag rnams de ltar rnam par du ma rnams su dang / rnam par rtog pa du ma rnams su dang / ches dga' ba du ma rnams su ngo bo nyid kyi lha de dag rnams kyi bag med pa dang nges par bral bar bya ba'i don du dang /
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin gyi lha de dag rnams kyis nam yang 'ga' zhig tu'ang mthong ma myong ba'i rtsed mo de dag rnams de ltar rnam par du ma rnams su dang / rnam par rtog pa du ma rnams su dang / ches dga' ba du ma rnams su ngo bo nyid kyi lha de dag rnams kyi bag med pa dang nges par bral bar bya ba'i don du dang /
translated: In order to free the gods from carelessness,

original: ji ltar de dag rnams kyi rgyags pa kun nas spangs par 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar de dag rnams kyi rgyags pa kun nas spangs par 'gyur bar ro //
translated: in order to completely remove their intoxication,

original: ngo bo nyid kyi lha de dag rnams kyis sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams kyi glu shin tu snyan par gyur pa rnams ji lta pa bzhin du thos pas ngo tsha bar gyur nas glu len par mi byed pa dang / gar yang mi byed /🔽'gying bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi lha de dag rnams kyis sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams kyi glu shin tu snyan par gyur pa rnams ji lta pa bzhin du thos pas ngo tsha bar gyur nas glu len par mi byed pa dang / gar yang mi byed / 'gying bar yang mi byed /
translated: The gods of the essence of the mountain, ashamed to hear the beautiful songs of the emanated gods, do not sing.🔽They do not dance.

original: dga' bar yang mi byed /🔽kun tu spyod par yang ni /
analyzed: dga' bar yang mi byed / kun tu spyod par yang ni /
translated: They do not flirt.🔽They do not enjoy themselves.

original: mi byed kyi /
analyzed: mi byed kyi /
translated: They do not act.

original: sprul pa de dag rnams kyi la lta bar 'dod pa'i yid rtse gcig pas thams cad nyid gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: sprul pa de dag rnams kyi la lta bar 'dod pa'i yid rtse gcig pas thams cad nyid gnas par gyur to //
translated: With one-pointed minds, they all watch the emanations.

original: de dag rnams kyis kyang rnam par du mar gar dang glu dang rgod pa dang 'gying bag dang rnam par rtog pa du mar dang / dga' bar 'gyur ba du mar gzhan rnams dang 'dra ba ma yin pa'i rnam pa du ma rnams kyang padma'i 'dab ma rnams @471a *//
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis kyang rnam par du mar gar dang glu dang rgod pa dang 'gying bag dang rnam par rtog pa du mar dang / dga' bar 'gyur ba du mar gzhan rnams dang 'dra ba ma yin pa'i rnam pa du ma rnams kyang padma'i 'dab ma rnams @471a *//
translated: The emanations sing and dance in many ways, with many kinds of laughter, flirtations, and thoughts, with many kinds of enjoyments that are unlike those of the gods.

original: la song nas lha de dag rnams glu len par byed pa dang / gar yang byed do //
analyzed: la song nas lha de dag rnams glu len par byed pa dang / gar yang byed do //
translated: They go to the lotus petals and sing and dance with the gods.

original: de nas gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyis lha de dag rnams kyi yid las su rung bar byas par go nas mu su lundha des sprul pa gnyis pa byed pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de nas gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyis lha de dag rnams kyi yid las su rung bar byas par go nas mu su lundha des sprul pa gnyis pa byed pa rnams ni /
translated: “When Musulundha realizes that the minds of the gods are now pliable, he will create a second emanation.

original: ji ltar padma'i 'dab ma rnams la gnas nas glu len par byed pa'i lha de dag rnams nyid kyi padma'i 'dab ma gcig sprul pa'i lha rnams kyis legs par gang ba rab tu lhung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar padma'i 'dab ma rnams la gnas nas glu len par byed pa'i lha de dag rnams nyid kyi padma'i 'dab ma gcig sprul pa'i lha rnams kyis legs par gang ba rab tu lhung ngo //
translated: The gods who had been singing from the lotus petals will now see that the lotus petals have been filled with emanated gods and will fall into the lake.

original: de nas mtsho de la lha de dag rnams las kha cig ni /🔽nub par gyur to //🔽kha cig ni /
analyzed: de nas mtsho de la lha de dag rnams las kha cig ni / nub par gyur to // kha cig ni /
translated: “Some of the gods in the lake will sink.

original: byung nas yang nub bo; ;la la dag ni /🔽lus rnams chu la brten nas rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: byung nas yang nub bo; ;la la dag ni / lus rnams chu la brten nas rgyal bar byed do //
translated: Some will emerge and then sink again.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some will swim in the water.

original: phan tshun kun tu 'khyud par byed pa dang nub par yang gyur nas ji lta ba bzhin du skyobs dang / bskyab par gyis dang zhes de ltar phan tshun du 'bod par byed cing /
analyzed: phan tshun kun tu 'khyud par byed pa dang nub par yang gyur nas ji lta ba bzhin du skyobs dang / bskyab par gyis dang zhes de ltar phan tshun du 'bod par byed cing /
translated: Some will embrace each other and then sink, calling out to each other, ‘Save me! Protect me!’

original: 'bod par byed pas kyang phan tshun du rten par byed pa dang / du bar yang byed pa dang / lhung ba dang bying bar yang gyur pa'i nyam nga ba chen po dang 'jigs pa chen po dang sdug bsngal chen po rnam pa du ma de dag rnams mtsho chen po de'i 'gram du song bar gyur pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis khyad par du mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'bod par byed pas kyang phan tshun du rten par byed pa dang / du bar yang byed pa dang / lhung ba dang bying bar yang gyur pa'i nyam nga ba chen po dang 'jigs pa chen po dang sdug bsngal chen po rnam pa du ma de dag rnams mtsho chen po de'i 'gram du song bar gyur pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis khyad par du mthong ngo //

translated: “ ‘Those who see that the nature of all that is deceptive is meaningless will understand the following.🔽The examples are a waterwheel, a city of gandharvas, and a mirage.

original: shin tu lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu lhag pa yin te /
translated: Those who are careless in the presence of these examples are even more careless.

original: yul gyi nye bar longs spyod pa rnams ni /🔽g-yo bar gyur pa ji lta ba'i don dang bral @478a *//
analyzed: yul gyi nye bar longs spyod pa rnams ni / g-yo bar gyur pa ji lta ba'i don dang bral @478a *//
translated: The enjoyment of objects

original: bas na zo chun 'khor mo dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / smig rgyu rnams las kyang bla lhag par stong pa yin no //
analyzed: bas na zo chun 'khor mo dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / smig rgyu rnams las kyang bla lhag par stong pa yin no //
translated: is devoid of any meaning, just like a waterwheel, a city of gandharvas, and a mirage.

original: gzhan yang cung zad rab tu ltung bar byed pa gang yin pa'i yul du gyur pa rnams cung zad yod pa'i ngam grog dang / g-yang sa dang 'dra ba de dag rnams kyi drung na'ang bag med pa shin tu lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang cung zad rab tu ltung bar byed pa gang yin pa'i yul du gyur pa rnams cung zad yod pa'i ngam grog dang / g-yang sa dang 'dra ba de dag rnams kyi drung na'ang bag med pa shin tu lhag pa yin te /
translated: Those who are careless in the presence of objects that are like a pit or a cliff are even more careless.

original: ngan song du log par ltung ba rnams nges par yang nyams su myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song du log par ltung ba rnams nges par yang nyams su myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They will definitely experience the downfall into the lower realms.

original: de ltar bag med pa 'dis ni /
analyzed: de ltar bag med pa 'dis ni /
translated: In this way,

original: lha rnams dang / srog chags su gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / 'gro ba lngar skyes par gyur pa rnams dang / khams gsum du gtogs pa rnams kyang log par ltung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha rnams dang / srog chags su gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / 'gro ba lngar skyes par gyur pa rnams dang / khams gsum du gtogs pa rnams kyang log par ltung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: carelessness causes the gods and all living beings, those born in the five classes of existence, and those belonging to the three realms to fall.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyis thams cad kyang rab tu brtson pa thams cad kyis gnas skabs thams cad du sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa rnams dang / bde ba 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang sdug bsngal rnams kyi rtsa ba 'di yongs su spang bar gyis dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyis thams cad kyang rab tu brtson pa thams cad kyis gnas skabs thams cad du sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa rnams dang / bde ba 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang sdug bsngal rnams kyi rtsa ba 'di yongs su spang bar gyis dang /
translated: Therefore, everyone, in all circumstances, with all your efforts, should abandon the root of suffering, which is the fear of suffering and the desire for happiness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: bag med pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'o //
translated: carelessness.

original: de nas yang de'i tshe na mu su lundha des tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa /
analyzed: de nas yang de'i tshe na mu su lundha des tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa /
translated: “Then, at that time, Musulundha will recite these verses:

original: ji ltar / bag yod pa ni dga' bar brjod //
analyzed: ji ltar / bag yod pa ni dga' bar brjod //
translated: ‘Carefulness is said to be delightful.

original: bag med sdug bsngal skal ldan yin //
analyzed: bag med sdug bsngal skal ldan yin //
translated: Carelessness is the cause of suffering.

original: bag yod @478b bag med pa dag gi /🔽'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid brjod //
analyzed: bag yod @478b bag med pa dag gi / 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid brjod //
translated: Carefulness and carelessness🔽are described in terms of their own characteristics.

original: de ltar lha rnams kyi mnga' bdag dam pa'i lam ji lta ba bzhin du ston par byed pa po des lha de dag rnams la rjes su 'doms par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar lha rnams kyi mnga' bdag dam pa'i lam ji lta ba bzhin du ston par byed pa po des lha de dag rnams la rjes su 'doms par byed do //
translated: In this way, the supreme ruler of the gods teaches the gods the true path.

original: de la lha de dag rnams thams cad kyang yid las su rung bar byas pa dang / dbang po rnams rgyas pa dang / dbang po rnams rab tu dang ba dang / yid rtse gcig tu gyur pas nyan par byed cing /
analyzed: de la lha de dag rnams thams cad kyang yid las su rung bar byas pa dang / dbang po rnams rgyas pa dang / dbang po rnams rab tu dang ba dang / yid rtse gcig tu gyur pas nyan par byed cing /
translated: The gods listen with pliable minds, their faculties expanded, their faculties clear, and their minds one-pointed.

original: mu su lundha padma'i snying po la sengge'i khri la gnas pa de la 'di ltar yang rjod par byed de /
analyzed: mu su lundha padma'i snying po la sengge'i khri la gnas pa de la 'di ltar yang rjod par byed de /
translated: They address Musulundha, who is seated on a lion throne in the center of the lotus, saying:

original: bdag cag rnams la shin tu phan par gyur pa dang mthar thug par bde ba gang yin pa de dag kyang 'dir brjod lags na /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams la shin tu phan par gyur pa dang mthar thug par bde ba gang yin pa de dag kyang 'dir brjod lags na /
translated: ‘You have explained to us what is truly beneficial and what is ultimately happiness.

original: bdag cag rnams la phan pa dang bde ba rnams kyang khyed nyid kyis bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams la phan pa dang bde ba rnams kyang khyed nyid kyis bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: Please tell us what will be beneficial and pleasant for us.

original: bdag cag rnams kyis ci bgyi ba'ang lha nyid kyi zhal snga nas bka' stsal tu gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyis ci bgyi ba'ang lha nyid kyi zhal snga nas bka' stsal tu gsol /
translated: Please tell us what we should do.”

original: ji ltar tshig 'di dag rnams brjod pa dang 'thab bral gyi bdag po des 'di skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar tshig 'di dag rnams brjod pa dang 'thab bral gyi bdag po des 'di skad ces brjod do //
translated: When they spoke these words, the lord of the gods said:

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “The Blessed One

original: thar pa'i spyod pa rnams rig cing rtogs la mkhyen pa /
analyzed: thar pa'i spyod pa rnams rig cing rtogs la mkhyen pa /
translated: knows, understands, and is aware of the conduct of liberation.

original: skyon rnams thams cad las rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: skyon rnams thams cad las rnam par grol ba /
translated: He is free from all faults,

original: yon tan rnams thams cad dang ldan pa /🔽sems can rnams thams cad kyi @479a *//
analyzed: yon tan rnams thams cad dang ldan pa / sems can rnams thams cad kyi @479a *//
translated: possesses all good qualities,🔽and is the foremost

original: yang gtso bor gyur pa'i sangs rgyas de la skyabs su song dang / sdug bsngal rnams thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang gtso bor gyur pa'i sangs rgyas de la skyabs su song dang / sdug bsngal rnams thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: of all sentient beings. Take refuge in that Buddha, and you will be free from all suffering.

original: de ni / bag med pa rnams dang bral ba yin pas de la skyabs su song na gong na med pa'i 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa rnams thams cad las yongs su skyob par 'gyur ro; ;de nas yang nges par mu su lundha'i drung nas lha de dag rnams kyis tshig 'di dag
analyzed: de ni / bag med pa rnams dang bral ba yin pas de la skyabs su song na gong na med pa'i 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa rnams thams cad las yongs su skyob par 'gyur ro; ;de nas yang nges par mu su lundha'i drung nas lha de dag rnams kyis tshig 'di dag
translated: “ ‘Those who go for refuge to him will be completely protected from all the dangers of cyclic existence. ’

original: thos pa dang / thams cad nyid kyis pus mo rnams sa gzhi la btsug te 'khor dang bcas pa rnams gus pa legs par skyes pa dang / don la dbang po rnams rgyas shing /
analyzed: thos pa dang / thams cad nyid kyis pus mo rnams sa gzhi la btsug te 'khor dang bcas pa rnams gus pa legs par skyes pa dang / don la dbang po rnams rgyas shing /
translated: “ ‘When the gods hear these words from Musulundha, they will all kneel on the ground with their retinues, and they will develop great respect.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la legs par gus pa skyes pa mgo bo kun tu btud par gyur pas rab tu phyag 'tshal te gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar byed pas kyang skyabs su song ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la legs par gus pa skyes pa mgo bo kun tu btud par gyur pas rab tu phyag 'tshal te gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar byed pas kyang skyabs su song ngo //
translated: Their faculties will be engaged with the meaning, and they will develop great respect for the blessed buddhas. They will bow their heads and pay homage, and they will go for refuge in the Three Jewels.

original: thams cad kyang sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams la'ang legs par skyabs su 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams la'ang legs par skyabs su 'gro bar byed do //
translated: They will also go for refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.’

original: yid shin tu rab tu dang ba dang / bag med pa rnams la'ang rnam par smod par byed cing bshags par byed de /
analyzed: yid shin tu rab tu dang ba dang / bag med pa rnams la'ang rnam par smod par byed cing bshags par byed de /
translated: They will also be very pure in mind and will condemn and confess their own carelessness.

original: gang dag bag med pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis bzod par mi nus pa rnams mang por mi bzad pa @479b rnam pa du ma rnams thams cad kyis shin tu sdug bsngal ba rnams mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag bag med pa'i lha de dag rnams kyis bzod par mi nus pa rnams mang por mi bzad pa @479b rnam pa du ma rnams thams cad kyis shin tu sdug bsngal ba rnams mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they see the many unbearable and intense sufferings of the careless gods.

original: de nas mu su lundha'ang lha de dag rnams kyi yid kun tu skyo par gyur pa de dag rnams legs par mthong nas slar nyid kyang cho 'phrul rnam pa du ma rnams byed de /
analyzed: de nas mu su lundha'ang lha de dag rnams kyi yid kun tu skyo par gyur pa de dag rnams legs par mthong nas slar nyid kyang cho 'phrul rnam pa du ma rnams byed de /
translated: “ ‘Then, Musulundha will see that the minds of the gods have become weary and he will again perform many miracles.

original: yud tsam gcig la'ang rnam pa du mar gcig tu gyur nas brgyar 'gyur ro; ;stong du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam gcig la'ang rnam pa du mar gcig tu gyur nas brgyar 'gyur ro; ;stong du 'gyur ro //
translated: In an instant he will transform from one into many, from many into one, from one into a hundred, and from one into a thousand.

original: stong phrag brgyar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong phrag brgyar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also transform into a hundred thousand.

original: yul tsam la'ang cha byad du ma dag tu byas pa'i dbyibs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul tsam la'ang cha byad du ma dag tu byas pa'i dbyibs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also transform into many different shapes in a single place.

original: yud tsam gcig la rnam pa du ma'i cha byad dag gis mtshungs par byas pa'i dbyibs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam gcig la rnam pa du ma'i cha byad dag gis mtshungs par byas pa'i dbyibs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In an instant, they will assume many different forms.

original: yul tsam nyid la nam mkha'i dkyil du 'phags nas rin po che'i khang bu sna tshogs pa rnams kyis kun tu gang ba rnams na /
analyzed: yul tsam nyid la nam mkha'i dkyil du 'phags nas rin po che'i khang bu sna tshogs pa rnams kyis kun tu gang ba rnams na /

original: gzugs dang cha byad sna tshogs pa rnams 'dzin par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang cha byad sna tshogs pa rnams 'dzin par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will assume various forms and shapes.

original: yud tsam la'ang chur 'bying bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam la'ang chur 'bying bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In an instant, they will sink into the water.

original: mgo bo stong du gyur nas kyang rin po che sna tshogs pa'i dbu rgyan dang dpung rgyan 'bar ba rnams kyis brgyan pa dang / nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i gzi brjid can lha'i tshogs rnams thams cad kyis yongs su bskor nas nye ba'i nags rnams thams cad du legs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: mgo bo stong du gyur nas kyang rin po che sna tshogs pa'i dbu rgyan dang dpung rgyan 'bar ba rnams kyis brgyan pa dang / nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i gzi brjid can lha'i tshogs rnams thams cad kyis yongs su bskor nas nye ba'i nags rnams thams cad du legs par mthong ngo //
translated: They will see themselves with a thousand heads, adorned with various precious ornaments, such as crowns and armlets, and with a splendor surpassing a thousand suns. Surrounded by the hosts of gods, they will see all the parks.

original: stong phrag brgyar gsal @480a *//
analyzed: stong phrag brgyar gsal @480a *//
translated: They will see themselves with a thousand eyes.

original: bar byed pa'i gzi brjid dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyi tshogs thams cad kyis yongs su bskor nas padma chen po de nyid kyi steng du 'byung bar byed pa dang / rang gi gzi brjid rnams kyis lam mer gyur par lha de dag rnams kyis lus shin tu blta bar dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: bar byed pa'i gzi brjid dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyi tshogs thams cad kyis yongs su bskor nas padma chen po de nyid kyi steng du 'byung bar byed pa dang / rang gi gzi brjid rnams kyis lam mer gyur par lha de dag rnams kyis lus shin tu blta bar dka' ba yin no //
translated: Surrounded by the entire assembly of gods endowed with the splendor of the creator, he emerges upon that great lotus, his body shining with its own splendor, difficult for the gods to behold.

original: gzhan yang mu su lundha de nyid kyis rdzu 'phrul gzhan yang byed par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang mu su lundha de nyid kyis rdzu 'phrul gzhan yang byed par gyur pa ni /
translated: “Moreover, Musulundha will perform another miracle.

original: lha de dag rnams nyid kyis bag med pa kun nas bsnyung bar bya ba'i don du 'di lta ste; kha nas lha brgya stong kun tu 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: lha de dag rnams nyid kyis bag med pa kun nas bsnyung bar bya ba'i don du 'di lta ste; kha nas lha brgya stong kun tu 'byung bar byed do //
translated: In order to make the gods overcome their carelessness, he will cause hundreds of thousands of gods to emerge from his mouth.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some of them

original: khang bu'i steng du zhon nas rin po che sna tshogs pa'i 'od rnams kyis lus shin tu gsal bar gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: khang bu'i steng du zhon nas rin po che sna tshogs pa'i 'od rnams kyis lus shin tu gsal bar gyur pa rnams so //
translated: will ride on the roofs of palaces, their bodies shining with the light of various jewels.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some of them

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i cha byad 'dzin par gyur pas /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i cha byad 'dzin par gyur pas /
translated: will wear various costumes.

original: glu'i rol mo rnams nye bar len par byed pa rnams lha rdzas kyi rgyan dang / cha byad dang / mchog tu lang tsho la bab pa'i lha mo rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas glu nye bar len pas mu su lundha'i kha nas byung nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: glu'i rol mo rnams nye bar len par byed pa rnams lha rdzas kyi rgyan dang / cha byad dang / mchog tu lang tsho la bab pa'i lha mo rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas glu nye bar len pas mu su lundha'i kha nas byung nas 'gro'o //
translated: The songs are accompanied by divine ornaments, costumes, and goddesses in the prime of youth.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some of the gods

analyzed: rin po che bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi padma gzhan dag rnams la nang du zhen nas snyan pa'i glu rnams len par byed pa dang / rtsi'ang @480b lha rdzas kyi ro dang dri dang yang dag par ldan pa dag 'thung bar byed de /

analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas lan brgya phrag rnams su dang / gal te na lan stong phrag tu'ang mdzes par gyur pa dang ldan pa'i lha rdzas kyi phreng ba'i mchog rnams kyis brgyan pa /
translated: Surrounded by their consorts, they are beautified by hundreds or even thousands of the most exquisite divine garlands.

analyzed: rang gi 'od kyi dpal 'bar ba dang ldan pa rnams yin no; ;gzhan yang lha gzhan dag rnams rnam pa gzhan gyis mu su lundha de'i kha nas kun tu byung nas 'gro na /
translated: “ ‘Moreover, other gods emerge from Musulundha’s mouth and proceed in other ways.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis sprul pa rnams la 'di lta ste; bya'i rgyab tu zhon pa rnams ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis sprul pa rnams la 'di lta ste; bya'i rgyab tu zhon pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who emanate through their magical powers ride on the backs of birds.

original: rin po che bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi bya rnams la mngon par zhon nas dga' bar byed pa dang / glu'ang len par byed pa dang / lhan cig spyod pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas rab kyi mchog tu rangs pa'i yid kyis rnga skad yan lag lnga dang ldan pa nyan par byed cing /
analyzed: rin po che bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi bya rnams la mngon par zhon nas dga' bar byed pa dang / glu'ang len par byed pa dang / lhan cig spyod pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas rab kyi mchog tu rangs pa'i yid kyis rnga skad yan lag lnga dang ldan pa nyan par byed cing /
translated: Riding on birds made of the seven precious substances, they enjoy themselves, sing songs, and, surrounded by their consorts, listen with the most delightful minds to the music of the five types of instruments.

original: bag med pas nye bar 'tsho ba rnams mu su lundha'i kha nas kun tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: bag med pas nye bar 'tsho ba rnams mu su lundha'i kha nas kun tu 'gro'o //
translated: Living carelessly, they proceed from Musulundha’s mouth.🔽“ ‘

original: lha ngo mtshar bar gyur pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gzugs gsal zhing sdug pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gzhan yang rnam pa gzhan gyis lha rnams sprul par byed pa na /
analyzed: lha ngo mtshar bar gyur pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gzugs gsal zhing sdug pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gzhan yang rnam pa gzhan gyis lha rnams sprul par byed pa na /
translated: The gods emanate other gods with similar, unequaled, clear, and beautiful forms.

original: ji ltar mu su lundha'i kha nas de dag nyid 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar mu su lundha'i kha nas de dag nyid 'gro ba ni /
translated: When they emanate in this way, they proceed from the mouth of Musulundha.🔽They ride in the center of a lotus filament,

original: autpala'i ze ba'i nang du zhon zhing rgyan rgyun par @481a *//
analyzed: autpala'i ze ba'i nang du zhon zhing rgyan rgyun par @481a *//
translated: adorned with a garland of flowers,

original: 'brel ba'i dbus su song nas lha rdzas kyi rnga skad yan lag lnga pa nyan par byed cing lha mo'i tshogs rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas lha rdzas kyi btung ba dag 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i dbus su song nas lha rdzas kyi rnga skad yan lag lnga pa nyan par byed cing lha mo'i tshogs rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas lha rdzas kyi btung ba dag 'thung bar byed do //
translated: and listen to the five types of divine music. Surrounded by a group of goddesses, they drink divine beverages.

original: glu yang len par byed la lhan cig spyod pa'i 'khor rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas lan brgya phrag dang / ci ste lan stong phrag dang / lan bye ba phrag rnams su'ang gzugs dang kha dog dang dbyibs dpe med pa'i lha'i bu mo mchog rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas dga' bar byed pa lha rdzas kyi nags dang nye ba'i nags su thabs du mar rab tu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: glu yang len par byed la lhan cig spyod pa'i 'khor rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas lan brgya phrag dang / ci ste lan stong phrag dang / lan bye ba phrag rnams su'ang gzugs dang kha dog dang dbyibs dpe med pa'i lha'i bu mo mchog rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas dga' bar byed pa lha rdzas kyi nags dang nye ba'i nags su thabs du mar rab tu sgrub par byed do //
translated: They sing songs and are surrounded by their retinue of consorts. They enjoy themselves for hundreds of times, for thousands of times, and for hundreds of thousands of times. Surrounded by the most beautiful goddesses with incomparable bodies, colors, and shapes, they enjoy themselves in many ways in divine forests and parks.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil du mngon par 'phags nas sa gzhi dag bzhin du 'gro bar byed la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil du mngon par 'phags nas sa gzhi dag bzhin du 'gro bar byed la /
translated: They fly up into the sky and travel on the ground.

original: rang bzhin pa'i lha de dag kyang glu de dag rnams nyan par byed do //🔽de dag gi drung na yon tan brgyas lhag par snyan par gyur pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin pa'i lha de dag kyang glu de dag rnams nyan par byed do // de dag gi drung na yon tan brgyas lhag par snyan par gyur pa /
translated: The original gods listen to their songs.🔽Their songs are a hundred times more beautiful than those of the original gods.

original: de dag gi glu dang de dag gi gzugs dang de dag gi bde ba'ang rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi glu dang de dag gi gzugs dang de dag gi bde ba'ang rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin no //
