translated: They will live in hardship.

original: 'dod pa de'i rgyus gang dag la spun dang spun rnams lhan cig tu 'thab rtsod byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa de'i rgyus gang dag la spun dang spun rnams lhan cig tu 'thab rtsod byed do //
translated: Because of desire, brothers and sisters will fight and quarrel together.

original: gsod pa dang 'ching ba rnams kyang phul du phyin par byed do //
analyzed: gsod pa dang 'ching ba rnams kyang phul du phyin par byed do //
translated: They will engage in killing and binding.

original: de dag kyang 'dod pa'i rgyu las yin //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod pa'i rgyu las yin //
translated: And that is because of desire.

original: @487b la; 'dod pa rnams kyi don gyis de bzhin du rgyal po dang rgyal po'ang lhan cig tu 'thab cing rtsod bar byed do //
analyzed: @487b la; 'dod pa rnams kyi don gyis de bzhin du rgyal po dang rgyal po'ang lhan cig tu 'thab cing rtsod bar byed do //
translated: Because of desire, kings will fight and quarrel with other kings.

original: g-yul 'gyed par byed do //
analyzed: g-yul 'gyed par byed do //
translated: They will wage war.

original: yul ljong rnams 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: yul ljong rnams 'joms par byed do //
translated: They will destroy the countryside.

original: phan tshun du gsod pa dang 'ching ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyi rtse mor phyin par byed do //
analyzed: phan tshun du gsod pa dang 'ching ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyi rtse mor phyin par byed do //
translated: They will engage in killing and binding, and they will reach the peak of various kinds of suffering.

original: de la de dag nyid thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin pas na /
analyzed: de la de dag nyid thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin pas na /
translated: All of that is for the sake of desire.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs 'di dag rnams kyang so sor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs 'di dag rnams kyang so sor shes par bya'o //
translated: “ ‘The faults of desire should be understood in this way.

original: gang gi phyir 'khor ba rnams thams cad kyi 'ching ba yin pa'i 'dod pa 'di dag rnams bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khor ba rnams thams cad kyi 'ching ba yin pa'i 'dod pa 'di dag rnams bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Desire is the fetter of all cyclic existence, and therefore it should be specifically understood.

original: de la rgyu 'di dag gis ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu 'di dag gis ni /
translated: For these reasons,

original: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bdag po des lha de dag rnams la rnam pa du ma dang rnam par rtog pa du mas kyang rdzu 'phrul de dag rnams byas so //🔽de lta bu dag ni /
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bdag po des lha de dag rnams la rnam pa du ma dang rnam par rtog pa du mas kyang rdzu 'phrul de dag rnams byas so // de lta bu dag ni /
translated: the ruler of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife will create many different kinds of miracles for the gods.

original: mi rnams kyi 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs rnams yin te /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs rnams yin te /
translated: “ ‘These are the faults of desire for humans.

original: gang gzhan dag rnams lha phar zhog gi /
analyzed: gang gzhan dag rnams lha phar zhog gi /
translated: But let us leave aside the gods.

original: rgyal po'ang rnam pa du ma dang bcas pa'i thabs rnams byed do //
analyzed: rgyal po'ang rnam pa du ma dang bcas pa'i thabs rnams byed do //
translated: Even a king will employ many different methods.

original: gang yang mi gzhan dag 'dod pa'i don du rgya mtshor 'jug par byed pa dang / 'khrug pa la lhan cig tu 'jug par byed pa dang / 'ching ba dang mya ngan dang ngal du ba dang sems khral dang 'thab rtsod dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i don med pa rnams kun @488a *//
analyzed: gang yang mi gzhan dag 'dod pa'i don du rgya mtshor 'jug par byed pa dang / 'khrug pa la lhan cig tu 'jug par byed pa dang / 'ching ba dang mya ngan dang ngal du ba dang sems khral dang 'thab rtsod dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i don med pa rnams kun @488a *//
translated: For the sake of others’ desires, they enter the ocean,🔽they enter into battle,

original: bzod par byed do //
analyzed: bzod par byed do //
translated: they endure all the pointless suffering of being bound, grieving, exhausted, anxious, fighting, and being destroyed.

original: de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa'i don du yin la /
analyzed: de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa'i don du yin la /
translated: All of this is for the sake of desire.

original: de ltar mi rnams thams cad 'dod pa rnams kyi don du nyes dmigs rnams kun nas bzod par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mi rnams thams cad 'dod pa rnams kyi don du nyes dmigs rnams kun nas bzod par byed do //
translated: In this way, people endure all the problems for the sake of desire.

original: ji ltar na yang lha rnams 'dod pa'i don du nyes dmigs rnams kun kyang bzod par byed pa yin na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang lha rnams 'dod pa'i don du nyes dmigs rnams kun kyang bzod par byed pa yin na 'di lta ste /
translated: How do gods endure problems for the sake of desire?

original: lha gang dag lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed bar byed pa dang / rtsod par byed pa dang / de dag gi de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin no //
analyzed: lha gang dag lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed bar byed pa dang / rtsod par byed pa dang / de dag gi de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin no //
translated: The gods who fight with the asuras and quarrel with them all do so for the sake of pleasures.

original: de bzhin du lha ma yin pa rnams kyang lha rnams dang lhan cig tu rtsod par byed pa dang / g-yul 'gyed par byed pa gang yin pa 'di dag kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha ma yin pa rnams kyang lha rnams dang lhan cig tu rtsod par byed pa dang / g-yul 'gyed par byed pa gang yin pa 'di dag kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs yin no //
translated: Similarly, the asuras quarrel and fight with the gods for the sake of pleasures.

original: dngos po rnams kho na'i rgyags pa gang yin pa de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kho na'i rgyags pa gang yin pa de dag rnams ni /
translated: The intoxication of things

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs yin no //
translated: is a fault of pleasures.

original: de la rgyu 'di rnams kyis kyang sprul pa rnams byas so //
analyzed: de la rgyu 'di rnams kyis kyang sprul pa rnams byas so //
translated: For these reasons, the Buddha created emanations.

original: gang yang klu rnams klu rnams dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed par byed cing yul gzhan dag rnams kyang 'jig par byed pa dang / glog dang thog la sogs pa'ang gtong bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin no //
analyzed: gang yang klu rnams klu rnams dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed par byed cing yul gzhan dag rnams kyang 'jig par byed pa dang / glog dang thog la sogs pa'ang gtong bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin no //
translated: The nāgas fight with the nāgas and destroy other countries, and they send down lightning and hail, all for the sake of desire.

original: yang gang dag dud 'gro rnams kyang phan tshun du @488b za bar byed ba dang gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs par byed pa rnams dang / 'thab par yang byed pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin te /
analyzed: yang gang dag dud 'gro rnams kyang phan tshun du @488b za bar byed ba dang gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs par byed pa rnams dang / 'thab par yang byed pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin te /
translated: Animals also kill, bind, and eat each other, and they fight with each other, all for the sake of desire.

original: 'di 'ang 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'ang 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //
translated: This is the danger of desire.

original: de bzhin du yi dvags rnams kyang zas kyi rgyu mtshan gyis sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi dvags rnams kyang zas kyi rgyu mtshan gyis sam /
translated: Likewise, ghosts fight with each other for the sake of food.

original: 'khrig pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis kyang phan tshun du ral gris gcod par byed pa dang / de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin no //🔽gang yang 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs de dag rnams yin pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di dag gis ni /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis kyang phan tshun du ral gris gcod par byed pa dang / de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dod pa rnams kyi don du yin no // gang yang 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs de dag rnams yin pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di dag gis ni /
translated: All of this is for the sake of sensual pleasures.

original: 'thab bral gyi mnga' bdag des bag med pa dang bral bar bya ba'i don du lha rnams la sbrul par byed do //
analyzed: 'thab bral gyi mnga' bdag des bag med pa dang bral bar bya ba'i don du lha rnams la sbrul par byed do //
translated: For these reasons, the ruler of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife emanates in order to free the gods from carelessness.

original: de bzhin du dmyal ba rnams kyang phan tshun du mngon par 'joms bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmyal ba rnams kyang phan tshun du mngon par 'joms bar byed de /
translated: “ ‘Likewise, in the hells, the beings fight each other.

original: nyes par byed pa'i las rnams kyis skyes pa gzhan rnams su gang dag dang zhe 'gras par gyur pa de dag rnams rjes su dran par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyes par byed pa'i las rnams kyis skyes pa gzhan rnams su gang dag dang zhe 'gras par gyur pa de dag rnams rjes su dran par 'gyur la /
translated: Due to their negative actions, they remember their former enemies.

original: rjes su dran nas kyang 'khon de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: rjes su dran nas kyang 'khon de dag rnams ni /
translated: Remembering them, they fight each other.

original: ral gri rnams kyis phan tshun du las byed par 'gyur ba kho na nye bar gnas pas bdag nyid dang gzhan dag rnams kyang gshog par byed do //
analyzed: ral gri rnams kyis phan tshun du las byed par 'gyur ba kho na nye bar gnas pas bdag nyid dang gzhan dag rnams kyang gshog par byed do //
translated: The swords are ready to strike each other, and so they strike both themselves and others.

original: de ltar yang dmyal ba rnams kyi nyes dmigs yin no //🔽de la rgyu mtshan 'di dag gis kyang 'dod pa rnams yongs su spong ba'i rgyur 'thab bral ba rnams kyi mnga' bdag de @489a *//
analyzed: de ltar yang dmyal ba rnams kyi nyes dmigs yin no // de la rgyu mtshan 'di dag gis kyang 'dod pa rnams yongs su spong ba'i rgyur 'thab bral ba rnams kyi mnga' bdag de @489a *//
translated: This is the danger of the hells.

original: sprul pa gzhan rnams byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa gzhan rnams byed pa yin no //
translated: For this reason, the lord of the gods in the Heaven Free from Strife manifests other emanations in order to cause the gods to give up their desires.

original: 'gro ba lnga po 'di dag rnams thams cad na ni /🔽'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs yod par yin no; ;gang yang 'khor ba las kha phyir phyogs par gyur pa de dag rnams thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga po 'di dag rnams thams cad na ni / 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs yod par yin no; ;gang yang 'khor ba las kha phyir phyogs par gyur pa de dag rnams thams cad ni /
translated: “ ‘In all five realms of existence,🔽there are dangers associated with desire.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du 'dod pa rnams las nges par 'byung bar ston par byed pa dang 'chad par yang byed do //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du 'dod pa rnams las nges par 'byung bar ston par byed pa dang 'chad par yang byed do //
translated: Those who turn away from cyclic existence will, in all circumstances, be taught and instructed to give up desire.

original: de la 'thab bral gyi bdag po des 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba rnams bstan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de la 'thab bral gyi bdag po des 'dod pa rnams kyi ro myang ba rnams bstan pa yin zhing /
translated: The ruler of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife teaches them the enjoyments of the pleasures of the senses.

original: nyes dmigs rnams kyang padma'i 'dab ma brgya po dang / lha rnams rab tu lhung bar gyur pa rang bzhin pa'i lha rnams la cung zad cig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes dmigs rnams kyang padma'i 'dab ma brgya po dang / lha rnams rab tu lhung bar gyur pa rang bzhin pa'i lha rnams la cung zad cig bstan pa yin no //
translated: He also teaches them a little about the problems of the gods, such as the hundred petals of the lotus and the gods falling.

original: rgyas par yang lha dang mi rnams kyi nyes dmigs gzhan dag kyang bdag gis bstan par bya yi /
analyzed: rgyas par yang lha dang mi rnams kyi nyes dmigs gzhan dag kyang bdag gis bstan par bya yi /
translated: “I will also teach you in detail about the other problems of the gods and humans.

original: nyes dmigs rnams legs par bstan nas nges par 'byung ba 'ang bdag gis bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nyes dmigs rnams legs par bstan nas nges par 'byung ba 'ang bdag gis bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having taught you the problems well, I will also explain the way out.

original: thar pa'i sa bon gyi rgyur gyur pa rang bzhin gyis lha rnams la phan pa'i don du dang / bde ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i sa bon gyi rgyur gyur pa rang bzhin gyis lha rnams la phan pa'i don du dang / bde ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of the natural gods, I will explain the seed of liberation, the cause of benefit and happiness.

original: gzhan yang lha de dag rnams la phan pa'i don du mu su lundha des 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs rnams mngon sum du byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang lha de dag rnams la phan pa'i don du mu su lundha des 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs rnams mngon sum du byed de /
translated: “Moreover, for the sake of the gods, Musulundha will make the problems of the pleasures of the senses directly perceptible.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs rnams gzhan rnams su mthong bar gyur pa dang / gzhan du'ang thos @489b par gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis kyang 'khor ba la yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs rnams gzhan rnams su mthong bar gyur pa dang / gzhan du'ang thos @489b par gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis kyang 'khor ba la yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The gods also become disenchanted with cyclic existence by seeing and hearing about the faults of desire in other realms.

original: de la rgyu mtshan 'dis lha de dag rnams la 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs rnams so sor sprul par byed do //
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan 'dis lha de dag rnams la 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs rnams so sor sprul par byed do //
translated: For this reason, the emanations reveal the faults of desire to the gods.

original: de nas lha de dag dang / lha ma yin dang / klu rnams kyi 'dod pa rnams la ro myang bar byed pa de dag rnams bstan nas nyes dmigs kun tu ston par byed de /
analyzed: de nas lha de dag dang / lha ma yin dang / klu rnams kyi 'dod pa rnams la ro myang bar byed pa de dag rnams bstan nas nyes dmigs kun tu ston par byed de /
translated: Having revealed the gods, demigods, and nāgas enjoying the pleasures of desire, they then reveal the faults of desire.

original: lha dang mi dang klu dang lha ma yin de dag rnams nyid kyang dus rnams mdor bsdu pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin pas so //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang klu dang lha ma yin de dag rnams nyid kyang dus rnams mdor bsdu pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin pas so //
translated: The gods, humans, nāgas, and demigods are all subject to the same process.

original: de la lha rnams ni /
analyzed: de la lha rnams ni /
translated: The gods

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'dod pa rnam pa du ma rnams la longs spyad nas 'chi 'pho ba'i dus byung bar gyur pa na de dag rnams ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du ston par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'dod pa rnam pa du ma rnams la longs spyad nas 'chi 'pho ba'i dus byung bar gyur pa na de dag rnams ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du ston par byed de /
translated: When the time comes for them to die and transmigrate, they will be shown the following.

original: rnam pa du ma sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: “In many different ways, they will die and transmigrate.

original: ri'i drung dag nas rnam pa du mar gyur ba byi la dang gung dang gzig dang ser ba cag cag dang lce spyang dang ri bong dang sengge dang phag pa dang klu dang dom dang stag dang srin bya dang rta dang stom ra dang glang po dang khva
analyzed: ri'i drung dag nas rnam pa du mar gyur ba byi la dang gung dang gzig dang ser ba cag cag dang lce spyang dang ri bong dang sengge dang phag pa dang klu dang dom dang stag dang srin bya dang rta dang stom ra dang glang po dang khva
translated: In the presence of mountains, they will see many different animals: cats, mongooses, leopards, hyenas, jackals, rabbits, lions, pigs, nāgas, bears, tigers, owls, horses, goats, elephants,

original: ta dang su su ka dang chu srin dang rus sbal dang rnga mo rnams kyi gdong gcig pa dang gdong gnyis pa dang gdong gsum pa dang gdong mang por gyur pa de dag rnams kha cig gi lag na ni /
analyzed: ta dang su su ka dang chu srin dang rus sbal dang rnga mo rnams kyi gdong gcig pa dang gdong gnyis pa dang gdong gsum pa dang gdong mang por gyur pa de dag rnams kha cig gi lag na ni /
translated: camels, ssu-su-ka birds, crocodiles, tortoises, and camels with one face, two faces, three faces, or many faces. Some of them will have

original: thal ba dang sol me thogs pa'o //
analyzed: thal ba dang sol me thogs pa'o //
translated: They hold ashes and burning coals.🔽

original: kha cig gi ni /🔽@490a *// thams cad rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig gi ni / @490a *// thams cad rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa'o //
translated: and some with ashes and burning coals.

original: kha cig gi ni /
analyzed: kha cig gi ni /
translated: Some are completely ablaze.

original: me'i char 'bebs par byed pa dang / rdo rje dang bcas pa'i ral gri kun nas 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: me'i char 'bebs par byed pa dang / rdo rje dang bcas pa'i ral gri kun nas 'phen par byed do //
translated: Some are struck by a rain of fire and by swords with vajras.

original: tho na kor kun nas 'jigs su rung ba'i sgra mang po rnams mngon par 'don par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: tho na kor kun nas 'jigs su rung ba'i sgra mang po rnams mngon par 'don par gyur pa ni /
translated: Many terrifying sounds are emitted from the walls.

original: ri dang thog 'bab pa dang mtshungs pa'i 'jigs pa chen po rnam pa du ma rnams yin te /
analyzed: ri dang thog 'bab pa dang mtshungs pa'i 'jigs pa chen po rnam pa du ma rnams yin te /
translated: There are many great terrors, like mountains and falling lightning.

original: char 'byung ba'i sprin mthing nag dang mdog 'dra bar 'jigs pa chen por gyur pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa de'i mgo bo ni /
analyzed: char 'byung ba'i sprin mthing nag dang mdog 'dra bar 'jigs pa chen por gyur pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa de'i mgo bo ni /
translated: The color of the clouds that bring rain, its great terrifying form has a head

original: ri dang mnyam par skra rnams dang / lus rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa brgya phrag mang po rnams dang de bzhin du stong phrag mang po rnams kyis kun nas bskor nas lag na zhags pa thogs pa dang / ral gri dang mdung dar rdo rje dang rdzogs lag na thogs pa 'jigs byed chen po'i gzugs su ston par byed pa rnams ri de dag gi khrod rnams nas byung ba nas nges par 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: ri dang mnyam par skra rnams dang / lus rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa brgya phrag mang po rnams dang de bzhin du stong phrag mang po rnams kyis kun nas bskor nas lag na zhags pa thogs pa dang / ral gri dang mdung dar rdo rje dang rdzogs lag na thogs pa 'jigs byed chen po'i gzugs su ston par byed pa rnams ri de dag gi khrod rnams nas byung ba nas nges par 'ong bar byed do //
translated: With hair like mountains, their bodies blazing with many hundreds of flames, and surrounded by many thousands of others, they hold nooses in their hands, swords, spears, and vajras.

original: gang na sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams yod pa der nye bar rgyug par byed do //
analyzed: gang na sprul pa'i lha de dag rnams yod pa der nye bar rgyug par byed do //
translated: They emerge from the mountains and approach the emanated gods.🔽With angry red faces, they transform into blue, yellow, and red colors, like the many-colored flames of a fire.

original: khros pas bzhin dmar po rnam par rol pa nye bar sgyur par byed pas sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po rnams kyi mdog gi me 'bar ba rnam par du mar char 'byung ba'i sprin mthing nag gi gseb rnams las bzhin du glog rnam @490b par 'byin
analyzed: khros pas bzhin dmar po rnam par rol pa nye bar sgyur par byed pas sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po rnams kyi mdog gi me 'bar ba rnam par du mar char 'byung ba'i sprin mthing nag gi gseb rnams las bzhin du glog rnam @490b par 'byin
translated: From the midst of the dark rain clouds, they emit lightning.

original: pas nges par rgyug par byed do //
analyzed: pas nges par rgyug par byed do //
translated: They run toward the emanations.

original: sprul pa gzhan rnams kha cig ni /
analyzed: sprul pa gzhan rnams kha cig ni /
translated: Some of the other emanations

original: 'chi bdag lta bur gyur pas mchog tu 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs rnams kyis gang na sprul pa de dag rnams yod par rgyug par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'chi bdag lta bur gyur pas mchog tu 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs rnams kyis gang na sprul pa de dag rnams yod par rgyug par byed pa ni /
translated: run toward the emanations in the form of the most terrifying of all, like the Lord of Death.

original: sna tshogs pa'i zhags pa dang lag cha thogs pa rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i zhags pa dang lag cha thogs pa rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: They are armed with various nooses and weapons.

original: lcags kyi rang bzhin las lag pa gyen du rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa 'brug bzhin du sgra kun nas sgrog par byed pa /
analyzed: lcags kyi rang bzhin las lag pa gyen du rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa 'brug bzhin du sgra kun nas sgrog par byed pa /
translated: They have hands that are blazing upward and are made of iron. They roar like thunder.

original: lus rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lus rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa /
translated: Their bodies are blazing.

original: dpag tshad bcu'i tshad tsam gyi gzugs can rnams so //

translated: “ ‘Just like gods sinking into a lake, I have witnessed with my own eyes how the many different thoughts that are so busy in cyclic existence cannot bear up.

original: 'dod pa rnams thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams thams cad ni /
translated: “ ‘All desires

original: mi rtag @500a *//
analyzed: mi rtag @500a *//
translated: are impermanent.

original: pa; sdug bsngal gyi mthar gtugs par byed pa bdag cag rnams rtag ba ma yin /🔽brtan pa ma yin /
analyzed: pa; sdug bsngal gyi mthar gtugs par byed pa bdag cag rnams rtag ba ma yin / brtan pa ma yin /
translated: They lead to suffering. We are not permanent,🔽not stable,

original: ther zug ma yin te /
analyzed: ther zug ma yin te /
translated: and not enduring.

original: de dag rnams la snying po cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de dag rnams la snying po cung zad kyang med do //
translated: They are not the slightest bit essential.🔽’

original: de nas 'thab bral gyi bdag po des lha de dag rnams kyi drung nas tshig gi cha 'di dag rnams thos nas 'di skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de nas 'thab bral gyi bdag po des lha de dag rnams kyi drung nas tshig gi cha 'di dag rnams thos nas 'di skad ces brjod do //
translated: “When the ruler of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife hears these words from the gods, he will say:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji lta bar 'di dag rnams thams cad sdug bsngal gyi mthar thug pa yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji lta bar 'di dag rnams thams cad sdug bsngal gyi mthar thug pa yin par gsungs so //
translated: ‘The Blessed One has said that all of this is ultimately suffering.🔽’

original: de nas lha de dag thams cad kyis kyang 'di skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: de nas lha de dag thams cad kyis kyang 'di skad ces brjod de /
translated: “The gods will then say:

original: bdag cag rnams thams cad ni /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams thams cad ni /
translated: ‘All of us

original: ji lta ba bzhin du de la yid song ba lags na /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du de la yid song ba lags na /
translated: If the mind is directed toward such a place,

original: ji ltar shin tu sdug bsngal ba rnams lha'i zhal snga nas shes par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu sdug bsngal ba rnams lha'i zhal snga nas shes par 'tshal lo //
translated: how can one know the faces of the gods in the midst of such great suffering?”

original: de nas de dag gi drung nas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi mnga' bdag des tshig de dag rnams thos nas 'di skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi drung nas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi mnga' bdag des tshig de dag rnams thos nas 'di skad ces brjod de /
translated: “ ‘Then, the ruler of the gods will hear their words and reply:

original: ji ltar 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ma lus pa de dag rnams ngas brjod par nus mod kyis kyang re zhig ngas khyed rnams la phyogs gcig tsam mngon par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ma lus pa de dag rnams ngas brjod par nus mod kyis kyang re zhig ngas khyed rnams la phyogs gcig tsam mngon par brjod par bya ste /
translated: “I can indeed describe all the sufferings of cyclic existence, but for now I will only tell you a small part of it.🔽If you were not to wander in cyclic existence due to carelessness,

original: 'khor ba rnams su ji lta bar bag med pa'i dbang gis 'gro bar ma gyur na ni; bskal pa bya ba stong phrag du ma rnams na /
analyzed: 'khor ba rnams su ji lta bar bag med pa'i dbang gis 'gro bar ma gyur na ni; bskal pa bya ba stong phrag du ma rnams na /
translated: you would be born in the higher realms after many thousands of eons.

original: kye ma dka' slas kyis bde 'gro'i 'gro bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /🔽'gro ba gnyis po lha dang mi dag rnyed pa ni /
analyzed: kye ma dka' slas kyis bde 'gro'i 'gro bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te / 'gro ba gnyis po lha dang mi dag rnyed pa ni /
translated: Alas, it is difficult to attain a birth in the higher realms.

original: shin tu @500b tu dka' ba yin zhing /
analyzed: shin tu @500b tu dka' ba yin zhing /
translated: It is very difficult to attain a birth among gods and humans.

original: gang dag bag med pa'i dbang du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: gang dag bag med pa'i dbang du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba de dag rnams ni /
translated: Those who do not fall under the power of carelessness

original: mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa yin no //
translated: are wise.

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis byung ba rnams kyang yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis byung ba rnams kyang yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: They avoid what arises through the power of conditions.

original: de dag gi dbang du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not fall under its power.

original: dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang byol song rnams su de dag skye'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang byol song rnams su de dag skye'o //
translated: They are born in the realms of hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: de la kye ho lha rnams 'gro ba gsum po rnams ngan song zhes mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: de la kye ho lha rnams 'gro ba gsum po rnams ngan song zhes mngon par brjod do //
translated: Alas, gods, these three realms are called the lower realms.

original: lta dang mi'i 'gro ba gnyis po ni /
analyzed: lta dang mi'i 'gro ba gnyis po ni /
translated: The two realms of gods and humans

original: bde 'gro zhes mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: bde 'gro zhes mngon par brjod do //
translated: are called the higher realms.

original: de dag rnams nyid re zhig ji ltar rab tu stobs che bar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal dag mngon par brjod par mi nus so //🔽rgyas par ni /
analyzed: de dag rnams nyid re zhig ji ltar rab tu stobs che bar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal dag mngon par brjod par mi nus so // rgyas par ni /
translated: It is impossible to describe the suffering of these realms in full, for it is so powerful.

original: ston pas mngon par brjod par spyod do //
analyzed: ston pas mngon par brjod par spyod do //
translated: The Teacher has described it in detail.

original: mdor bsdu bar gyur na lha dang mi rnams kyi sdug bsngal rnams ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdu bar gyur na lha dang mi rnams kyi sdug bsngal rnams ni /
translated: In brief, the suffering of gods and humans

original: rnam pa bcu drug go /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug go /
translated: has sixteen aspects.

original: yang lha dang mi rnams kyi de'ang bdag yin na; bde 'gro'i 'gro bas sdus pa'i sdug bsngal du gyur pa rnams la 'di lta ste /🔽srid ba bar ma do'i sdug bsngal dang / mngal na gnas pa'i yang ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mngal nas kun tu 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / zas kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi mthun pa rnams dang kun tu phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: yang lha dang mi rnams kyi de'ang bdag yin na; bde 'gro'i 'gro bas sdus pa'i sdug bsngal du gyur pa rnams la 'di lta ste / srid ba bar ma do'i sdug bsngal dang / mngal na gnas pa'i yang ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mngal nas kun tu 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / zas kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi mthun pa rnams dang kun tu phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: “If the gods and humans are also the self, then the sufferings that are included in the happy destinies are as follows:🔽the suffering of the intermediate state of existence, the suffering of being in the womb, the suffering of emerging from the womb, the suffering of food, the suffering of desire, the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant,

original: sdug pa rnams dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pas bcings pa'i sdug bsngal dang / nad kyi sdug bsngal dang / gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i sdug bsngal dang / tshol khro'i sdug @501a *//
analyzed: sdug pa rnams dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pas bcings pa'i sdug bsngal dang / nad kyi sdug bsngal dang / gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i sdug bsngal dang / tshol khro'i sdug @501a *//
translated: the suffering of being separated from what is pleasant, the suffering of being bound by cold, heat, and so on, the suffering of disease, the suffering of being under the power of others, the suffering of searching,

original: bsngal dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang 'dre bar byed pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bu dang bu mo dang gnyen 'dun rnams gyi brel dog gi sdug bsngal dang / bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dbang chung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang /🔽lhag par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal shin tu sdug bsngal bas shin tu sdug bsngal ba ni /
analyzed: bsngal dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang 'dre bar byed pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bu dang bu mo dang gnyen 'dun rnams gyi brel dog gi sdug bsngal dang / bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dbang chung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / lhag par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal shin tu sdug bsngal bas shin tu sdug bsngal ba ni /
translated: and the suffering of being in a very bad state.

original: 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of death is the suffering of being in a very bad state due to the suffering of being in a very bad state.

original: ji ltar rab tu stobs che ba'i sdug bsngal chen po bcu drug po de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu stobs che ba'i sdug bsngal chen po bcu drug po de dag rnams ni /
translated: These are the sixteen great sufferings that are very powerful.

original: mi'i 'jig rten pa rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten pa rnams kyi yin te /
translated: They are for those who are born in the human world.

original: 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa rnams mi'i 'jig rten du skyes pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa rnams mi'i 'jig rten du skyes pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: They are for those who are born in the human world, up to the suffering of death.

original: gang sems can gzhan dag rnams la ni /
analyzed: gang sems can gzhan dag rnams la ni /
translated: For other sentient beings,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan dag rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan dag rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: other kinds of suffering arise.

original: shin tu'ang bsran par mi bzod pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: shin tu'ang bsran par mi bzod pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are extremely difficult to bear.

original: gang yang mthar thug pa kho nar zad par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / rab tu 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi bde ba ni /
analyzed: gang yang mthar thug pa kho nar zad par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / rab tu 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi bde ba ni /
translated: The pleasure of those who are not destined to die and those who are not destined to be destroyed

original: 'di dang srid pa gzhan rnams na'ang med do //
analyzed: 'di dang srid pa gzhan rnams na'ang med do //
translated: does not exist in this world or in other worlds.

original: de la re zhig drang po kho nar srid pa bar ma dor skyes pa'i dri za srid pa bar ma do pa'i tha snyad can rnams kyi rnam pa ji lta bu'i sdug bsngal yin na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig drang po kho nar srid pa bar ma dor skyes pa'i dri za srid pa bar ma do pa'i tha snyad can rnams kyi rnam pa ji lta bu'i sdug bsngal yin na 'di lta ste /
translated: First, the pleasure of those who are born in the intermediate existence of the gandharva, who are called “those in the intermediate existence,” is of this kind:

original: las kyi rlung gis btab par gyur pa rnams sha'i mig gis mngon sum du blta bar byar med par lha'i mig gis @501b mthong bar gyur pa dang / thogs pa med par gyur pa'i rang bzhin can de'ang gang gi tshe mir skye bar 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe ji lta bu'i rnam par 'di skye bar 'gyur ba rnams dang /
analyzed: las kyi rlung gis btab par gyur pa rnams sha'i mig gis mngon sum du blta bar byar med par lha'i mig gis @501b mthong bar gyur pa dang / thogs pa med par gyur pa'i rang bzhin can de'ang gang gi tshe mir skye bar 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe ji lta bu'i rnam par 'di skye bar 'gyur ba rnams dang /
translated: They are struck by the wind of karma and, without being able to see with their physical eyes, they see with their divine eye. They are of a nature that is unimpeded. When they are born as humans, they are born in this way.

original: rnams pa ji lta bu'i khyim du 'di skye bar 'gyur ba rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: rnams pa ji lta bu'i khyim du 'di skye bar 'gyur ba rnams kyang ste /
translated: and the type of family into which he will be born.

original: dman pa dang bar ma dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i khyim rnams su sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang shes rab kyi 'bras bu can rnams la skye bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: dman pa dang bar ma dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i khyim rnams su sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang shes rab kyi 'bras bu can rnams la skye bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: If he is to be born in a family that is inferior, middling, or superior, and in a family that is the result of generosity, morality, or wisdom,

original: dri za de'ang rnam pa de lta bur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dri za de'ang rnam pa de lta bur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then the gandharva will be of that type.

original: srid pa bar ma do pa 'di'i zas kyi rigs su gyur pa rnams ni /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma do pa 'di'i zas kyi rigs su gyur pa rnams ni /
translated: The types of food of this intermediate existence being🔽are as follows.

original: gal te dbul po'i khyim rnams su skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dbul po'i khyim rnams su skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If he is to be born in a poor family,

original: de'i zas rnams hrud hrud po dang / mdog ngan pa dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / tshad rnams kyang dman par 'gyur te /🔽sbyin pa'i mthu chung bar gyur pa'i phyir na skye ba na'ang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i zas rnams hrud hrud po dang / mdog ngan pa dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / tshad rnams kyang dman par 'gyur te / sbyin pa'i mthu chung bar gyur pa'i phyir na skye ba na'ang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: his food will be coarse, of bad color, smell, taste, touch, and quantity.

original: de la 'di ni /
analyzed: de la 'di ni /
translated: Because his power of generosity is weak, he will not obtain food even when he is born.

original: mir skye bar gyur pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi dang po yin no //
analyzed: mir skye bar gyur pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first suffering of those born as humans.

original: de nas skyes par gyur nas las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mngal na gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas skyes par gyur nas las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mngal na gnas par gyur te /
translated: Then, having been born, by the power of karma and the afflictions, he enters the womb.

original: dbul po'i khyim du skye bar 'gyur na ma'i zas ngan pa dang / gyong po dang / skyur mo'i zas rnams dang / zas chung par gyur na 'ang sha ma la rab tu brten pas lte ba'i spubs nas rab tu spel bar byed pa'i srog chags mngal na gnas pa kha dog ngan pa dang lus rid par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dbul po'i khyim du skye bar 'gyur na ma'i zas ngan pa dang / gyong po dang / skyur mo'i zas rnams dang / zas chung par gyur na 'ang sha ma la rab tu brten pas lte ba'i spubs nas rab tu spel bar byed pa'i srog chags mngal na gnas pa kha dog ngan pa dang lus rid par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: If he is to be born in a poor family, he is nourished by the mother’s poor, meager, sour, and small food, and he is born with a bad complexion and a thin body.

original: ma'i lus g-yo bar @502a *//
analyzed: ma'i lus g-yo bar @502a *//
translated: By the fault of the mother’s movements,

original: gyur pa'i skyon gyis shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur pas gsus pa'i gseb na rgyug par byed do //
analyzed: gyur pa'i skyon gyis shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur pas gsus pa'i gseb na rgyug par byed do //
translated: he runs in her belly, and is very unhappy.

original: zas su gyur pa grang ba dang dro ba dag gis byas pas kyang ste /
analyzed: zas su gyur pa grang ba dang dro ba dag gis byas pas kyang ste /
translated: He is also affected by her food, whether cold or hot.

original: de ltar gzir bar byed pa mnar ba'i mchog tu phyin pa la 'ang go skabs ye med pa skabs med pa /
analyzed: de ltar gzir bar byed pa mnar ba'i mchog tu phyin pa la 'ang go skabs ye med pa skabs med pa /
translated: Thus, he is tormented, and there is no opportunity for him to escape from this most intense torment.

original: rnam par khro bar byed na'ang spungs med pa /
analyzed: rnam par khro bar byed na'ang spungs med pa /
translated: Even if he wants to cry out, he cannot.

original: gcin dang rtug pa'i phung po chen po'i nang du bying bar gyur pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal chen po rnam pa du ma rnams yin no //🔽de la 'di ni /
analyzed: gcin dang rtug pa'i phung po chen po'i nang du bying bar gyur pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal chen po rnam pa du ma rnams yin no // de la 'di ni /
translated: They sink into a great mass of urine and excrement and experience many kinds of great suffering.

original: gzhan gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The second kind of suffering is as follows:

original: bde 'gro ba rnams kyang de 'dra na dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: bde 'gro ba rnams kyang de 'dra na dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If even those in the fortunate realms have such suffering, what need is there to mention the suffering of the hells, the realm of hungry ghosts, and the animal realm?

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal gsum pa yod de /🔽de'i rjes thogs la gal te mngal nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba na ma'i skye gnas kyi bug pa'i zor ma mig nas gzir bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal gsum pa yod de / de'i rjes thogs la gal te mngal nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba na ma'i skye gnas kyi bug pa'i zor ma mig nas gzir bar gyur pa ni /
translated: The third kind of suffering is as follows:🔽If you are to be born from a womb, you are squeezed through the mother’s birth canal,

original: ji ltar bu ram gyi shing 'khrul dmig gis bu gu nas 'byung ba na btsir bar gyur pas 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mngal gyi de yang ma'i skye gnas kyi bu ga nas kun tu 'byung ba yin no //🔽de la 'di ni /🔽mngal nas skye ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bu ram gyi shing 'khrul dmig gis bu gu nas 'byung ba na btsir bar gyur pas 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mngal gyi de yang ma'i skye gnas kyi bu ga nas kun tu 'byung ba yin no // de la 'di ni / mngal nas skye ba ste /
translated: as if you were being pushed through a hole in a sugarcane press.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan yin no //
translated: The third kind of suffering is as follows:🔽If you are to be born from a womb, you are squeezed through the mother’s birth canal,🔽as if you were being pushed through a hole in a sugarcane press.

original: de dag gi rjes thogs la sdug bsngal bzhi pa yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes thogs la sdug bsngal bzhi pa yod de /
translated: After that, there is the fourth suffering.

original: mar gsar pa dang chu shing gi lo ma ltar shin tu 'jam par gyur pa'i lus rab tu smin pa gzhon sha can gyi dper gyur pa'i lus dang ldan pa rnams gang @502b ge tshe btsas pa na ma mas rtsub pa dang rod rod por dang rdol pa
analyzed: mar gsar pa dang chu shing gi lo ma ltar shin tu 'jam par gyur pa'i lus rab tu smin pa gzhon sha can gyi dper gyur pa'i lus dang ldan pa rnams gang @502b ge tshe btsas pa na ma mas rtsub pa dang rod rod por dang rdol pa
translated: When the very tender body, which is like fresh butter or a banana tree leaf, is born, the mother or nurse holds it with her rough, hard, calloused,

original: dang mdog ngan pa dang las su mi rung ba dang ring ba dang bar mig can 'thug pa dang rtse mo dang sgra mi snyan pa dag gi lag pa gnyis kyis len par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar mes sreg par byed pa'am /
analyzed: dang mdog ngan pa dang las su mi rung ba dang ring ba dang bar mig can 'thug pa dang rtse mo dang sgra mi snyan pa dag gi lag pa gnyis kyis len par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar mes sreg par byed pa'am /
translated: unpleasant, unworkable, long, thick, pointed, and unpleasant sounding hands.

original: ral gris gtub par byed pa de bzhin du shin tu 'jam pa'i phyir na 'di la'ang zug gzer skyed do //
analyzed: ral gris gtub par byed pa de bzhin du shin tu 'jam pa'i phyir na 'di la'ang zug gzer skyed do //
translated: At that time, it is as if it is being burned by fire or cut by a knife, because it is very tender.

original: de'i lus shin tu 'jam por gyur pa 'di gal te dang por gos 'jam po rnams bskon par gyur kyang de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: de'i lus shin tu 'jam por gyur pa 'di gal te dang por gos 'jam po rnams bskon par gyur kyang de dag rnams ni /
translated: If that very tender body is first wrapped in soft clothes,

original: ji ltar bslangs pa dang 'thug pa dang rtsub pa dang rdol ba dang rab tu rnying pa dang btsems pa dang bskums pa rnams kyi nang du lus bcug pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bslangs pa dang 'thug pa dang rtsub pa dang rdol ba dang rab tu rnying pa dang btsems pa dang bskums pa rnams kyi nang du lus bcug pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is as if one were to enter a house that is very cold, thick, rough, dilapidated, very old, and full of holes.

original: grang ba'i dus su 'di'ang shin tu grang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: grang ba'i dus su 'di'ang shin tu grang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In cold weather, it is very cold there.

original: btsas pa na khyim gang yin par ni; grang bas shin tu yang nyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btsas pa na khyim gang yin par ni; grang bas shin tu yang nyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: When born, one is very much afflicted by the cold in the house.

original: de bzhin du tshad pa'i dus su tshad pa shin tu stobs che bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad pa'i dus su tshad pa shin tu stobs che bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gzhan yang 'thab bral gyi bdag po des lha de dag nyid la phan par bya ba'i don du chos ston par byed do //

original: mi rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang dag zhe na /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang dag zhe na /

analyzed: kye lha dag /

analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten na mi rnams shin tu'ang sdug bsngal ba rnams ni /

analyzed: 'di lta ste / bu dang rang gi skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /

analyzed: mi rnams kyi mi'i 'jig rten na rang gi skye bo rnams sam; bu dang bu mo rnams kyang rung ste /

analyzed: gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'am /

analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa dang dbul ba la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i zug gzer rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: or the pain of hunger, thirst, poverty, and so on.

analyzed: de'i tshe de dag rnams kyi zug gzer gyi rgyu mtshan gyis gang dag la de dag dga' ba dang rjes su mthun par gyur pa'i phyir na de'i tshe de @512a *//
translated: At that time, because of the pain of those, whatever is agreeable and pleasing to them,

analyzed: la'ang zug gzer shin tu che bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la mthun par byas pas byis pa 'di yang gzhan gyi brel dog gis byas pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan yin no //
translated: Because of acting in accordance with that, this child has other sufferings created by the distress of others.

analyzed: mi rnams nyid la yin gyi / bde 'gro gzhan rnams la ni /

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //

analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa rnams thams cad kyang las bya dgos pa'i mthar thug pa dang / yang gang du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag rnams thams cad kyang legs pa ma yin no //
translated: All the sciences are ultimately for the sake of action, and wherever there is death, there is no good.

original: 'khor ba na'ang sdug bsngal che ba rnams kyi phul du phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba na'ang sdug bsngal che ba rnams kyi phul du phyin pa ni /
translated: In saṃsāra, the greatest suffering is

analyzed: 'di dag yin te; 'di ltar skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba rnams so //

analyzed: de'ang thams cad mi'i 'jig rten rnams na dmigs so //

analyzed: de ltar rnam pa du ma rnams su shis pa'i lam du gyur pa bla na med pa'i don de nyid legs par ston par byed do //
translated: In this way, the king teaches the meaning of the unsurpassed path of good fortune in many ways.

original: gang la'ang nye bar len pa med par mi'i 'jig rten 'dir don gyi dra ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang la'ang nye bar len pa med par mi'i 'jig rten 'dir don gyi dra ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: In this human world, various kinds of meaningful webs appear, but they are not appropriated by anyone.

original: yang de la ci zhig yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de la ci zhig yod pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: ngan song gsum gyi sa gzhi @512b zhes bya bar brgya stong bye ba phrag du ma rnams dang bye ba las 'das pa rnams su'ang sdug bsngal dpe med pa rnams sngon du song bar gyur pa'i mi'i 'jig rten pa rnams so //
translated: In the three lower realms, the grounds of the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts, there are many hundreds of thousands, many millions, and even more than that, of incomparable sufferings.

original: yang 'brang bar byed /
analyzed: yang 'brang bar byed /

translated: When gods die and transmigrate from the happy realms, some gods who are not very careless will say to them:

original: kye he lha dag /
analyzed: kye he lha dag /
translated: “Kye ma!

original: bde 'gro las kyis pa mi rnams su ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar 'gro bar gyis dang / gang gi tshe mi rnams nas yang dus byed par gyur pa de'i tshe gnyen bshes dang grogs po'i tshan pa rnams kyis shis pa brjod pa legs par sbyin par byed pa /
analyzed: bde 'gro las kyis pa mi rnams su ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar 'gro bar gyis dang / gang gi tshe mi rnams nas yang dus byed par gyur pa de'i tshe gnyen bshes dang grogs po'i tshan pa rnams kyis shis pa brjod pa legs par sbyin par byed pa /
translated: Gods, you should go to the human world, where you will experience the results of your karma. When you die as a human, your friends and relatives will give you auspicious blessings.

original: bde 'gro lha rnams kyi 'jig rten du song zhig ces byas so //
analyzed: bde 'gro lha rnams kyi 'jig rten du song zhig ces byas so //
translated: “Go to the world of the gods, who are happy!”

original: de ltar na gnyis ka ltar yang bde 'gror 'gyur ba yin no //🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis ka ltar yang bde 'gror 'gyur ba yin no // de dag ni /
translated: Thus, in both cases, they will go to a happy rebirth.

original: 'gro ba gnyis yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis yin no //
translated: These are the two types of rebirth.

original: gzhan ma 'gro ba gsum po rnams kyang mtshungs par yang sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma 'gro ba gsum po rnams kyang mtshungs par yang sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: The other three types of rebirth are also equally miserable.

original: de ltar 'di ni /🔽phan pa rnams rjes su tshol bar byed pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni / phan pa rnams rjes su tshol bar byed pa /
translated: Thus, this king of the gods,🔽who seeks to benefit others,

original: gzhan rjes su 'dzin par byed pa la rab tu zhugs par gyur pa /
analyzed: gzhan rjes su 'dzin par byed pa la rab tu zhugs par gyur pa /
translated: who is engaged in caring for others,🔽always roams about mindfully.🔽With many different kinds of voices,🔽with many different kinds of thoughts,

original: rtag tu'ang bag yod pas rnam par rgyu ba'i 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bdag bos rnam pa du ma rnams dang / rnam par rtog pa mang po rnams dang / thabs du ma rnams kyis kyang rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams dang / mthar thug pa dang /🔽bla na med par gyur @513a *//
analyzed: rtag tu'ang bag yod pas rnam par rgyu ba'i 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bdag bos rnam pa du ma rnams dang / rnam par rtog pa mang po rnams dang / thabs du ma rnams kyis kyang rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams dang / mthar thug pa dang / bla na med par gyur @513a *//
translated: and with many different kinds of methods,

original: pa'i chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: pa'i chos ston par byed do //
translated: he teaches the Dharma in many different ways.🔽It is ultimate🔽and unsurpassed.

original: des bu dang bu mo'i sdug bsngal 'di dag rnams bstan nas gzhan yang lha de dag rnams nyid la mi'i sdug bsngal rnams ston par byed do //
analyzed: des bu dang bu mo'i sdug bsngal 'di dag rnams bstan nas gzhan yang lha de dag rnams nyid la mi'i sdug bsngal rnams ston par byed do //
translated: Having shown them the sufferings of sons and daughters, he also shows them the sufferings of humans.

original: gang dag zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de ni / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pas byas pa zhes bya ba sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi phul du phyin pa yin no //
translated: Hunger and thirst are the most intense of all sufferings.

original: de la'ang mi rnams kyis mi rigs pa rnam pa du ma gang dag yin pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang bkres pa dang skom pa'i rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal rnams kyis mnar pas yin no; ;gzhan ni /
analyzed: de la'ang mi rnams kyis mi rigs pa rnam pa du ma gang dag yin pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang bkres pa dang skom pa'i rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal rnams kyis mnar pas yin no; ;gzhan ni /
translated: And all the many kinds of human suffering are caused by the suffering of hunger and thirst.

original: de lta bur rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sdug bsngal de bzhin gshegs pa mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bur rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sdug bsngal de bzhin gshegs pa mi gsung ngo //
translated: The Tathāgata does not speak of other kinds of suffering like that.

original: sdug bsngal ji ltar bkres pa dang skom pas byas pa zhes bya ba des 'jigs pas kyang mi rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yang ba rnams sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ji ltar bkres pa dang skom pas byas pa zhes bya ba des 'jigs pas kyang mi rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yang ba rnams sgrub par byed do //
translated: Because of the fear of suffering caused by hunger and thirst, people seek out various kinds of food.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

translated: Those who are born into a great family but are poor, with their hands folded in supplication, their eyes covered with tears, and their voices choked with sobs.

analyzed: yang gang dag rdzun du smra bar byed pa de dag rnams thams cad kyang dbul bas zil gyis mnan par gyur pas bkres pa dang skom pa'i mi'i 'jigs pa rnams kyis @513b gzir ba rnams kyis yin no //
translated: And those who tell lies are all poor, tormented by the fear of hunger and thirst.

original: gang yang gzhan du ni /
analyzed: gang yang gzhan du ni /
translated: And others:

analyzed: gson pa la'ang the tshom za bar 'gyur ba rnams kyang skyes bu dag gis bgrang bar mi byed de /
translated: “Those who are doubtful about life are not counted by people.

original: mtshon cha'i tshogs rnams kun tu 'khrug pa dang / glang po che'i mche ba'i dkrigs ka ya nga ba'i sa rnams su g-yul 'gyed pa la 'jug par byed pa de dag rnams kyis de thams cad kyang bkres pa dang skom pa'i 'jigs pas mnar ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: mtshon cha'i tshogs rnams kun tu 'khrug pa dang / glang po che'i mche ba'i dkrigs ka ya nga ba'i sa rnams su g-yul 'gyed pa la 'jug par byed pa de dag rnams kyis de thams cad kyang bkres pa dang skom pa'i 'jigs pas mnar ba rnams yin no //
translated: They engage in battles in places that are terrifying due to the clashing of weapons and the tusks of elephants. All of them are tormented by the fear of hunger and thirst.

analyzed: de'ang gzhan dag rnams su dpag tshad brgya stong phrag du ma rnams kyi chu srin ti mi ti mingga dang / chu srin na kra dang / chu srin ma ka ra dang / ri ra sho dang / rlabs kyi ngam grog rnams su srog dang 'bral ba dang mtshungs pa dum rnams la'ang zhugs nas skyes bu dag rgya mtshor rab tu 'jug par byed do; ;de dag rnams thams cad kyang bkres pa dang skom pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal gyis yin no //
translated: Moreover, they enter the ocean, which is like a place of death for many hundreds of thousands of leagues, with its timitimiṅgila fish, its krakaca fish, its makara fish, its rishoas, and its waves and whirlpools. All of them do so because of the suffering caused by hunger and thirst.

original: gang yang gzhan dag rnams la'ang rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa du ma rnams kyis kyang yang dag brjod par mi nus pa'i rnam pa de srid kyi sdug bsngal rnams la mi dag rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang gzhan dag rnams la'ang rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa du ma rnams kyis kyang yang dag brjod par mi nus pa'i rnam pa de srid kyi sdug bsngal rnams la mi dag rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: And for others, they are engaged in various kinds of suffering that cannot be described in any way.

original: de dag rnams thams cad kyang gsod pa'i don du ste /🔽gsod du khrid par gyur pa rnams gsod pa'i rnga ba ta ha brdungs par gyur cing me tog k'a ra b'i ra'i phreng bas mgo la gtags nas gsal shing @514a *//
analyzed: de dag rnams thams cad kyang gsod pa'i don du ste / gsod du khrid par gyur pa rnams gsod pa'i rnga ba ta ha brdungs par gyur cing me tog k'a ra b'i ra'i phreng bas mgo la gtags nas gsal shing @514a *//
translated: All of them are being led to their deaths.🔽They are led to the place of execution, where the executioner’s drum is beaten and the condemned are beheaded with a sword, their heads marked with a garland of karavīra flowers.

original: gi mdun du khrid par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa rnams kyis sems dang 'das par gyur pa'i bzhin can rnams srog gi tha mar gyur pa'i 'jig rten du khrid par byed pa rnams las gzhan la ni /
analyzed: gi mdun du khrid par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa rnams kyis sems dang 'das par gyur pa'i bzhin can rnams srog gi tha mar gyur pa'i 'jig rten du khrid par byed pa rnams las gzhan la ni /
translated: They are led to the place of execution with expressions of terror on their faces, their lives coming to an end.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sdug bsngal rnams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sdug bsngal rnams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other suffering like it.

original: ji ltar bkres pa dang skom pas byas pa las gzhan rnams ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bkres pa dang skom pas byas pa las gzhan rnams ni /
translated: The others are not like hunger and thirst.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sdug bsngal nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sdug bsngal nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The rest are not like the suffering of hunger and thirst.

original: de'i phyir so sor gzhom par bya ba'i don du sbyin pa sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor gzhom par bya ba'i don du sbyin pa sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, give gifts in order to overcome each of them individually.

original: sems dang zhing dang dngos po rnams phun sum tshogs pa dang / dus su rigs pa dang yul du mkho ba rnams kyang rab tu brtson pa dang / rnam par 'gyur ba med par byas la gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang zhing dang dngos po rnams phun sum tshogs pa dang / dus su rigs pa dang yul du mkho ba rnams kyang rab tu brtson pa dang / rnam par 'gyur ba med par byas la gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Give gifts with a perfect mind, field, and object, at the right time, in the right place, and with the right effort, and without changing your mind.

original: 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa rnams kyis 'jigs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de dag lha rnams la'ang yod mod kyi /🔽'khor ba na zas kyis byas pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa rnams kyis 'jigs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de dag lha rnams la'ang yod mod kyi / 'khor ba na zas kyis byas pa rnams ni /
translated: The gods have the fear of the dangers of cyclic existence and the suffering of conceptualization.

original: shin tu nyung zad cig yin no //🔽bkres pa dang skom pa dang kun nas bral bar bya ba'i don du sbyin pa dag ni /
analyzed: shin tu nyung zad cig yin no // bkres pa dang skom pa dang kun nas bral bar bya ba'i don du sbyin pa dag ni /
translated: But in cyclic existence, those that are caused by food are very few.

original: gtang bar gyis shig /
analyzed: gtang bar gyis shig /
translated: Therefore, give gifts in order to be free from hunger and thirst.

original: kye he lha dag /
analyzed: kye he lha dag /
translated: O gods,

original: de la 'di ni /
analyzed: de la 'di ni /
translated: this is the way to give gifts.

original: mi rnams kyi mi'i 'jig rten gyi bkres pa dang skom pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa du ma'i sdug bsngal gzhan rnams yin te /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi mi'i 'jig rten gyi bkres pa dang skom pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa du ma'i sdug bsngal gzhan rnams yin te /
translated: The other sufferings are the many thoughts of hunger and thirst that humans experience in the human world.

original: gang yang de dag rnams @514b ni; shin tu 'jam par gyur pa'i lha rdzas kyi bde ba shin tu chung bas kyang zil gyis non /
analyzed: gang yang de dag rnams @514b ni; shin tu 'jam par gyur pa'i lha rdzas kyi bde ba shin tu chung bas kyang zil gyis non /
translated: These are far surpassed by the extremely soft and subtle divine pleasures.

analyzed: phal che bar gyur ba'i lha rdzas kyi zas dang skom gyi dngos po rnyed par sla bar gyur pa rnams kyang lha dag gis rig pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: The divine food and drink that are easily obtained are not even known to the gods.

original: 'dod pa'i khams 'di ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams 'di ni /
translated: This desire realm🔽is surrounded by the suffering of the terrifying and fearful nature of hunger and thirst.

original: nye 'khor rnams thams cad na'ang bkres pa dang skom par gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'jigs pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rlung gis btab pas kun tu 'bar bar gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nye 'khor rnams thams cad na'ang bkres pa dang skom par gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'jigs pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rlung gis btab pas kun tu 'bar bar gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: The gods are tormented by the winds of suffering.

original: de la lha dag rings pa rings pas mi rnams su skye bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: de la lha dag rings pa rings pas mi rnams su skye bar ma byed cig /
translated: Therefore, gods, do not quickly take birth among humans!

original: phyir zhing nyid kyang yid la byas par gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyir zhing nyid kyang yid la byas par gyur ta re /
translated: You should think about this!

original: mi'i 'jig rten pa rnams ni /
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten pa rnams ni /

translated: They will age and die, and they will not attain the permanent state of deathlessness.🔽For these reasons, do not engage in carelessness!

original: bde ba ma yin no //🔽rtag pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba ma yin no // rtag pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: These pleasures are not happiness.

original: 'di dag gis ni /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni /
translated: They are not permanent.🔽They are not peace.🔽They are not sublime.

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bsam gtan gyi bde ba bla na med pa rnams kyi bcu drug gi char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bsam gtan gyi bde ba bla na med pa rnams kyi bcu drug gi char yang mi phod do //
translated: They do not compare to even a sixteenth of the unsurpassed bliss of the wisdom of the dhyāna of the uncontaminated.

original: de @520a *// nas de dag gi drung nas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bdag po des tshig de dag rnams thos nas gzhan yang lha de dag rnams nyid kyi mngon sum du nyes dmigs rnams byed do /
analyzed: de @520a *// nas de dag gi drung nas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bdag po des tshig de dag rnams thos nas gzhan yang lha de dag rnams nyid kyi mngon sum du nyes dmigs rnams byed do /
translated: “Then, having heard those words from the gods, the ruler of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife will again make the gods directly perceive the faults.

original: yang gzhan brjod pa /
analyzed: yang gzhan brjod pa /
translated: He will say:

original: ji ltar khyod kyis bdag cag rnams la ston par bgyid pa de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis bdag cag rnams la ston par bgyid pa de dag rnams ni /
translated: ‘You have taught me.

original: phan par 'dod pa lags pas de ltar bdag cag rnams kyis bgyi lags so //🔽lha lags / gzhan yang ji ltar na /
analyzed: phan par 'dod pa lags pas de ltar bdag cag rnams kyis bgyi lags so // lha lags / gzhan yang ji ltar na /
translated: Since you wish to benefit me, I will do as you say.

original: bdag cag rnams kyis kun tu 'dod chags pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal de dag gis bdag cag gis 'thob par mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams kyis kun tu 'dod chags pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal de dag gis bdag cag gis 'thob par mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: “‘Your Majesty, how can we avoid the suffering that is created by our own desire?

original: de nas dus de'i tshe na mu su lundha des tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs brjod pa ji ltar /
analyzed: de nas dus de'i tshe na mu su lundha des tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs brjod pa ji ltar /
translated: “At that point Musulundha will sing these verses:

original: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon po yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon po yin //
translated: “ ‘One is one’s own protector.

original: gzhan gang rjes su mgon por gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gang rjes su mgon por gyur //
translated: Who else could be one’s protector?

original: gang phyir bdag nyid legs btul bas /
analyzed: gang phyir bdag nyid legs btul bas /
translated: Since one is well trained by oneself,

original: rtag pa'i go 'phang 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag pa'i go 'phang 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: And attain the state of permanence.

original: legs pa'i las byas mdzes 'gyur ltar //
analyzed: legs pa'i las byas mdzes 'gyur ltar //
translated: “ ‘Just as beautiful actions are beautiful,

original: mgon po gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mgon po gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: So is the protector, nothing else.

original: skye ba gzhan ni stong du yang //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan ni stong du yang //
translated: “ ‘Even in a thousand other lives,

original: de la de dag rjes su 'jug /
analyzed: de la de dag rjes su 'jug /
translated: They will follow you.🔽“ ‘You will reach the supreme abode,

original: rga dang 'chi ba spangs pa yi; ;gnas kyi mchog tu 'bab par byed //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba spangs pa yi; ;gnas kyi mchog tu 'bab par byed //
translated: Free from aging and death.

original: shin tu dge ba'i rang las 'di //
analyzed: shin tu dge ba'i rang las 'di //
translated: “ ‘This extremely virtuous action

original: bsam pa yis ni lha yi mchog /
analyzed: bsam pa yis ni lha yi mchog /
translated: Will lead to the highest god realms.

original: legs pa'i las la spyod par gyis //
analyzed: legs pa'i las la spyod par gyis //
translated: Engage in virtuous actions!

original: phan chen zas ni de las za //
analyzed: phan chen zas ni de las za //
translated: Eat the food of great benefit!

original: de mu su lundha des lha de dag rnams la bstan nas gzhan yang brjod pa /
analyzed: de mu su lundha des lha de dag rnams la bstan nas gzhan yang brjod pa /
translated: “ ‘Musulundha teaches the gods, saying,

original: song la nags dang nye ba'i nags rnams su brgyus nas 'dod par gyur pa'i sgra dang ro dang gzugs dang dri rnams @520b  khrid par gyur kyang gang gi phyir khyed rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bag yod par gyis /
analyzed: song la nags dang nye ba'i nags rnams su brgyus nas 'dod par gyur pa'i sgra dang ro dang gzugs dang dri rnams @520b  khrid par gyur kyang gang gi phyir khyed rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bag yod par gyis /
translated: ‘Go and explore the forests and parks. Bring back sounds, tastes, forms, and smells that you desire. But be careful, just as you are now.

original: de nas de ltar gyur pa dang / de nas lha de dag gis tshig de dag rnams thos par gyur pa dang 'di skad ces yod do //
analyzed: de nas de ltar gyur pa dang / de nas lha de dag gis tshig de dag rnams thos par gyur pa dang 'di skad ces yod do //
translated: then those gods, having heard those words, said this:🔽“Yes, it is so.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bdag cag rnams kyis smon lam gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bdag cag rnams kyis smon lam gdab par bya ste /
translated: We will make a prayer just as it is.

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bla na med pa'i  bu 'dul ba kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bla na med pa'i  bu 'dul ba kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: In the future, when he will have arisen, the Perfectly Awakened One, the unsurpassed, the tamer of beings to be tamed,🔽the guide,

original: mtshan byams pa zhes bya ba de'i gsung rab la bdag cag rnams mi'i 'jig rten du skye bar gyur cig /
analyzed: mtshan byams pa zhes bya ba de'i gsung rab la bdag cag rnams mi'i 'jig rten du skye bar gyur cig /
translated: the one whose name is Maitreya, in his teaching may we be born in the human world.

original: ji ltar / 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'dus pa dang po de bdag cag rnams byed pa dang / chos rnams nyan nas zag pa zad par byed par yang bdag cag gyur cig /
analyzed: ji ltar / 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'dus pa dang po de bdag cag rnams byed pa dang / chos rnams nyan nas zag pa zad par byed par yang bdag cag gyur cig /
translated: And just as he will have arisen in the future, may we be the ones who make the first assembly, and having heard the Dharma, may we be the ones who exhaust the defilements.”

original: de ltar kha cig gis ni /
analyzed: de ltar kha cig gis ni /
translated: In that way, some made a prayer

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab par gyur to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab par gyur to //
translated: for unsurpassed, perfect awakening.

original: smon lam btab nas sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams la nye bar skyabs su'ang song par gyur to //🔽de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: smon lam btab nas sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams la nye bar skyabs su'ang song par gyur to // de dag rnams ni /
translated: They made aspirations and went for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: nges par yang byams pa'i gsung rab la mi'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par yang byams pa'i gsung rab la mi'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will definitely be born in the human world during the teachings of Maitreya.

original: lha gzhan stong phrag bdun cu po rnams ni /
analyzed: lha gzhan stong phrag bdun cu po rnams ni /
translated: The other seventy thousand gods

original: lhan cig tu dam pa'i chos thos nas zag pa rnams ni /🔽zad par byed do; ;gang yang gzhan de dag rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: lhan cig tu dam pa'i chos thos nas zag pa rnams ni / zad par byed do; ;gang yang gzhan de dag rnams kyis ni /
translated: heard the sublime Dharma and exhausted their defilements.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku gdung ni /🔽mthong bar 'gyur la sngon dang por de dag rnams kyis gya nom pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @521a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku gdung ni / mthong bar 'gyur la sngon dang por de dag rnams kyis gya nom pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @521a *//
translated: Those others will see the relics of that thus-gone one

original: pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab pa yin no //
translated: and will make aspirations for the first time for the excellent, unsurpassed, complete and perfect awakening.

original: gzhan yang lha brgya phrag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi sems su yongs su bsngos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang lha brgya phrag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi sems su yongs su bsngos so //
translated: Moreover, hundreds of gods dedicated their minds to the state of a solitary buddha.

original: de dag rnams thams cad kyis kyang smon lam rnams 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnams thams cad kyis kyang smon lam rnams 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: All of them will have their aspirations fulfilled.

original: de nas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bdag po des yid kyis rtogs par gyur nas bdag gis gzhan la phan pa shin tu mang ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bdag po des yid kyis rtogs par gyur nas bdag gis gzhan la phan pa shin tu mang ba byas te /
translated: “ ‘Then, the lord of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife will understand what is happening and think, “I have done so much to benefit others.

original: de dag rnams slar yang bag med pas 'phrog par mi 'gyur bar 'thab bral gyi bdag po des rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: de dag rnams slar yang bag med pas 'phrog par mi 'gyur bar 'thab bral gyi bdag po des rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: I will now give my permission so that the lord of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife can prevent the gods from being carried away by carelessness once again.

original: lha de dag rnams yid las su rung bar byas pa dang / yid legs par dul bar byas pas mu su lundha de la g-yas phyogs nas bskor ba byas nas mtsho de'i drung du song bar gyur to //
analyzed: lha de dag rnams yid las su rung bar byas pa dang / yid legs par dul bar byas pas mu su lundha de la g-yas phyogs nas bskor ba byas nas mtsho de'i drung du song bar gyur to //
translated: “ ‘The gods, who have now become pliable and well-trained, will circumambulate Musulundha to his right and then proceed to the lake.

original: mu su lundha yang gzhan la phan pa de dag rnams byas nas phyir yang sa gzhan rnams kyi lha gzhan rnams la phan par bya ba'i don du legs par song bar gyur to //
analyzed: mu su lundha yang gzhan la phan pa de dag rnams byas nas phyir yang sa gzhan rnams kyi lha gzhan rnams la phan par bya ba'i don du legs par song bar gyur to //
translated: Musulundha, for his part, will have done what he could to benefit others and will now proceed to the next level to benefit the gods there.’

original: 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyi sa las; rtag tu bde ba'i sa ste brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyi sa las; rtag tu bde ba'i sa ste brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The eighth stage is the stage of constant bliss, which is beyond the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife.

original: mu su lundha'i rdzu 'phrul chen po zhes bya ba'ang rdzogs so ///
analyzed: mu su lundha'i rdzu 'phrul chen po zhes bya ba'ang rdzogs so ///
translated: The great magical power of Musulundha is also complete.
